When Revealed: Count the number of encounter cards in the staging area and shuffle them into the encounter deck. Then, reveal an equal number of cards from the encounter deck and add them to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Rabble
shadow_text: Shadow: Deal the attacking enemy an additional shadow card for each player in the game.
text: Forced: When Orc Rabble is dealt a shadow card, it gets +2 [Attack] until the end of the phase.

name: Orc Arsonist
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. Deal it another shadow card.
text: Forced: When Orc Arsonist engages a player, deal 1 shadow card to each enemy engaged with that player.

name: Scourge of Mordor
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. Deal it another shadow card.
text: When Revealed: Each player discards the top card of his deck. Until the end of the phase, raise the total [Threat] in the staging area by X, where X is the total cost of all cards discarded by this effect.

flavor:
The White Council has sent you by ship to Gondor to help fight the threat of Mordor. Upon arrival in the port city of Pelargir, you are greeted by Lord Alcaron who takes you to The Leaping Fish where you can speak privately.

Inside the tavern, Lord Alcaron looks nervously toward the door as he hands you a scroll bearing the seal of Gondor. He asks that you deliver it to Faramir in Ithilen, but the brigands who just entered look intent on taking it from you.
name: The Leaping Fish
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for The Leaping Fish and Alcaron's Scroll. Make The Leaping Fish the active location and attach Alcaron's Scroll to a hero.

Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

When Revealed: Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Harbor Thug and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

flavor: During the fight in the tavern, one of your adversaries managed to grab Alcaron's Scroll and flee outside. You chase the thief into the street where you are surrounded by a gang of his fellow brigands. You must fight your way through the mob and recover the scroll!
name: Fighting in the Streets
text:
Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

The players cannot advance to the next stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero.

When Revealed: Attach Alcaron's Scroll to the highest engagement cost enemy in play, if able. Otherwise, add Alcaron's Scroll to the staging area.

flavor: You've recovered the scroll but are still outnumbered by your determined foes. Lord Alcaron shouts for you to escape and deliver the scroll before he flees to summon the city guard. If you can get to your ship, you can escape the clutches of these desperate thugs...
name: Escape to the Quays
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 enemy and adds it to the staging area.

Enemies cannot be optionally engaged.

Forced: The first enemy revealed from the encounter deck each round makes an immediate attack against the player who controls Alcaron's Scroll from the staging area.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Alcaron's Scroll is attached to a hero. If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

flavor:
You've arrived in Ithilien with a sealed message for Faramir, only to learn that he has gone north to defend Cair Andros from massing enemy forces.

Faramir has left a company of rangers in Ithilien, tasked on ambushing Southrons as the march toward Cair Andros. Their captain, Celador, offers to lead you to Cair Andros after the approaching enemy is destroyed...
name: Ambush in Ithilien
text:
Setup: Add Celador to the staging area. Search the encounter deck for a copy of Ithilien Road and make it the active location. Each player must search the encounter deck for a copy of Southron Company and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Battle. (Characters use [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)

If the players complete this stage with Celador in the staging area, advance to stage 3A (bypassing stage 2).

flavor: The Southron army was larger and better prepared than the rangers anticipated, and now your dwindling company is painfully overmatched. Your only option is a disciplined withdrawl to Cair Andros, before being overwhelmed by the enemy reinforcements hurrying up the road to join the fight.
name: Southron Counter-attack
text:
Siege. (Characters use [Defense] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
Archery X.
X is the number of players in the game.
After this stage is completed advance to stage 4A (bypassing stage 3).

flavor: Having helped his rangers scatter the first wave of Haradrim invaders, Celador leads you north along a hidden trail that runs through Itailien. But more Southrons are marching up the forest road. Not it is a foot race to reach Cair Andros before the enemy.
name: The Hidden Way
text:
When Revealed: The first player takes control of all Ranger objectives in the staging area.
Enemies do not make engagement checks and cannot be optionally engaged.

flavor: The island fortress of Cair Andros rises from the middle of the Anduin. From a distance all is quiet, but as you near the island and night approaches a raucous cry is heard on the wind. The horns of Mordor sound in response. The enemy is moving on Cair Andros, and the assault will soon begin. You must reach it before all hope is lost.
name: Approaching Cair Andros
text:
If any player's threat is 37 or higher, Approaching Cair Andros gains siege.
Forced: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

flavor:
The island fortress of Cair Andros, which guards Gondor's northernmost causeways over the river Anduin, is under siege! Battering rams rumble up the eastern causeway and rafts filled with Orcs float across the river toward the lightly defended northern banks.

The assault is relentless, and the defenders grow weary. The tide is slowly but surely turning against you...
name: The Defense
text:
Setup: Add The Approach, The Citadel, and The Banks to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Siege (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

Players must deal damage from undefended attacks to the lowest [Threat] Battleground location in play. If there are no Battleground locations in play, immediately advance to the next stage.

flavor: As smoke and rending cries fill the air, rafts of Orcs beach their crafts all along the northern banks. You must reach the shore and drive them back into the river before a solid foothold can be established.
name: Reinforcing the Banks
text: Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.

flavor: With a crashing boom the eastern gate shatters. A ram has broken through, and the pressing host of Orcs pour into the courtyard beyond. Engage them in hand-to-hand combat and secure the gate!
name: Breakthrough at the Approach
text:
Battle. (Characters quest using [Attack] instead of [Willpower].)

Forced: After the players quest unsuccessfully, instead of raising threat, each player must choose and discard 1 character he controls.

flavor: Orc scramblers have infiltrated the island and climbed over the walls. They fought to the western gate, and the gate fell. Now a new host of enemies that were lying in wait are breaching the Citadel itself!
name: Breakthrough at the Citadel
text:
Siege (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

Breakthrough at the Citadel adds 5 [Threat] to the staging area.

flavor: The defenders of Cair Andros have survived brunt upon brunt of the enemie's assault, but the coutcome of the battle hangs on the edge of a knife. One last heroic effort is required to save the fortress and win the victory...
name: The Last Battle
text:
Siege. (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.
If the players have collected 4 or more victory points, The Last Battle gains battle and loses siege.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

flavor: Hirluin the Fair of the Green Hills from Pinnath Gelin... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Hirluin the Fair
text: Ranged. You may use resources from Hirluin the Fair's resource pool to pay for Outlands ally cards of any sphere.

flavor: ... grim-faced they were, and shorter and somewhat swarthier than any men that Pippin had yet seen in Gondor. <cite> The Return of the King</cite>
name: Warrior of Lossarnach
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [defense].

flavor: "Nay, my friends, I am the lawful master of the Stone, and I had both the right and the strength to use it..." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gaining Strength
text: Action: Discard 2 resources from your hero's resource pool to add 3 resources to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: ...foremost on the field rode the swan-knights of Dol Amroth with their Prince and his blue banner at their head. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Knights of the Swan
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [attack].

flavor:
There flowered a White Tree, and that was for Gondor...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Shield
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains +1 [defense]. (+2 [defense] instead if attached hero has the Gondor trait.)

flavor:
We heard of the horns in the hills ringing,
the swords shining in the South-kingdom.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ethir Swordsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 [willpower].

name: Ring of Barahir
text: Attach to a hero. Attached hero gets +1 hit point for each Artifact attachment attached to it. If attached hero is Aragorn, he also gains a [lore] resource icon.

flavor: From the Anfalas, the Langstrand far away, a long line of men of many sorts, hunters and herdsmen and men of little villages... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Anfalas Herdsman
text: Each Outlands character you control gets +1 hit point.

flavor: "Let none now reject the counsels of Gandalf, whose long labours against Sauron come at last to their test." <cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Mithrandir's Advice
text: Action: Draw 1 card for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon.

flavor: The townlands were rich, with wide tilth and many orchards, and homesteads there were with oast and garner, fold and byre, and many rills rippling through the green from the highlands down to the Anduin. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: A Good Harvest
text: Action: Name a sphere. Until the end of the phase, you can spend resources of any sphere when paying for cards that belong to the named sphere.

flavor:
Even as foes mass from without, the Steward of Minas Tirith fears there are enemies within. You have been asked to investigate the possibility of a conspiracy within the White City...

You begin your investigation at The Fourth Star, a popular tavern...
name: Conspiracy
text:
Setup: Create the underworld deck. Remove Roots of Mindolluin from the encounter deck and set it aside, out of play. Shuffle all Villain cards and randomly set one aside, out of play, without looking at it. Remove the others from the game. Repeat this with all Plot cards.

When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for The Fourth Star and make it the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location, place 1 resource token on this quest.
If there are 4 or more resource tokens on Conspiracy, advance to the next stage.

flavor: You have uncovered crucial information about the dissident plot, and even gleaned hints of teh conspirator's secretive leader. Clues have led you to a cavern deep in the heart of Mount Mindolluin. As you descend into the ancient rock, you begin to suspect the clues that led you here may have been misleading... that you may have been lured away from the city streets for a purpose.
name: The Grand Design
text:
When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Plot card and add it to the staging area.
When Revealed: Make Roots of Mindolluin the active location, returning any other active location to the staging area.
Forced: After the active location leaves play as an explored location place 1 resource token on this quest.
If there are 4 or more resource tokens on The Grand Design, advance to the next stage.

flavor: You have unmasked the conspiracy and its champion is upon you. The wheels of treachery are in motion, and only a heroic effort can stop the cabal's plan in time...
name: The Confrontation
text:
When Revealed: Reveal the set aside Villain card and add it to the staging area.
When Revealed: Shuffle the underworld deck into the encounter deck.
The players cannot defeat this stage while a Villain is in play. If this stage is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: Underworld Dissident
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, remove 1 token from the current quest.
text: Underworld Dissident gets +1 [Attack] for each Underworld location in play.

name: Daughter of Beruthiel
text:
Daughter of Beruthiel cannot be optionally engaged.
Forced: After Daughter of Beruthiel attacks, return her to the staging area. The engaged player may raise his threat by 4 to prevent this effect.

name: The Hand of Castamir
text:
Forced: After The Hand of Castamir attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck, resolve its effects, and discard it.
Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, The Hand of Castamir makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Telemnar's Bane
text:
Forced: When Telemnar's Bane attacks, discard the top 3 cards of each player's deck.
Forced: After a player plays an event card, Telemnar's Bane makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Sewers
text:
Underworld 1.
When Revealed: Place the top card of the underworld deck facedown underneath the active location, if able.

flavor: "Were it buried beneath the roots of Mindolluin, still it would burn your mind away..." - Gandalf, The Return of the King
name: Roots of Mindolluin
text:
Underworld 1.
Each location in the staging area gets +2 quest points.

flavor: Great stores of goods and food, and beer, were found that had been hidden away... - The Return of the King
name: Storehouse
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. (+2 [Attack] instead if undefended.)
text: Underworld 1.

flavor: "The houses of the dead are no places for the living." - Gandalf, The Return of the King
name: Houses of the Dead
text:
Underworld 2.
Forced: After Houses of the Dead becomes the active location, exhaust all characters.

name: The Fourth Star
text:
Underworld X.
X is the number of players in the game.
Response: When The Fourth Star leaves play as an explored location, each player may draw 1 card.

name: Unwelcome Discovery
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the underworld deck and add it to the staging area. If it is a Clue card, discard it instead.

name: A Knife in the Back
text: When Revealed: Randomly select 1 ally controlled by the first player, if able. The first player deals X damage to one of his heroes, where X is that ally's [Attack]. Then discard that ally. If no ally is discarded by this effect, A Knife in the Back gains surge.

name: False Lead
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove all tokens from the current quest.
text: When Revealed: End the quest phase without resolving the quest.

name: A Scrap of History
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 1 resource token on the current quest.

Victory 1.

name: Secret Map
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective and attach it to that hero.
Action: If attached to a hero, add Secret Map to the victory display to place 3 progress tokens on the active location.
Victory 1.

name: A Prisoner
text:
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective, add it to the victory display, and place 2 resource tokens on the current quest.

Victory 1.

name: Unholy Alliance
text:
Reveal 1 additional card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area during the staging step each round.
If a hero is destroyed by an enemy attack, the players have lost the game.

name: Up in Flames
text:
Forced: At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Up in Flames and discard the top X cards of each player's deck. X is the number of resource tokens on Up in Flames.
If any player has no cards in his deck, the players have lost the game.

flavor: "... whispering was in your ears, poisoning your thought..." - Gandalf, The Two Towers
name: Poisoned Counsels
text: At the end of each round, raise each player's threat by 2.

flavor:
"...the Elves feared and distrusted the world outside..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Mirlonde
text: Each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon gets -1 threat cost.

flavor: "Forlong!" men shouted. "True heart, true friend!" <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forlong
text: While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, ready Forlong at the beginning of each phase.

flavor: And so the companies came and were hailed and cheered and passed through the Gate, men of the Outlands marching to defend the City of Gondor in a dark hour... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Strength of Arms
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Ready each ally in play.

flavor: He slew many of them and the rest fled. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Mighty Prowess
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy that shares a Trait with the enemy just destroyed.

name: Trained for War
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, if the current quest does not have Siege, it gains Battle.

flavor:
"The Elves have their own labours and their own sorrows..."
<cite>Gildor, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silvan Refugee
text: Forced: After a character leaves play, discard Silvan Refugee from play.

flavor: "Courage will now be your best defense against the storm that is at hand..." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Against the Shadow
text: Play only if each hero you control has the printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, [spirit] characters use their [willpower] instead of [defense].

flavor: For the Elves of the High Kindred had not yet forsaken Middle-earth, and they dwelt still at that time at the Grey Havens...<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Harbor Master
text: Response: After a card effect adds any number of resources to the resource pool of a hero you control, Harbor Master gains +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor: Suddenly he halted and listened. Had he heard a whistle or not? Or was it the call of some strange bird? <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Advance Warning
text: Play only if each hero you control has a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Until the end of the phase, enemies do not make engagement checks.

flavor: The watchmen cried aloud, and all men in the City stood to arms. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: White Tower Watchman
text: If each hero you control belongs to the same sphere of influence, you may assign damage from undefended enemy attacks to White Tower Watchman instead of a hero you control.

flavor:
The leader of the underworld cabal from Minas Tirith has fled with his remaining henchmen. You have followed his trail to the Druadan Forest, hoping to bring the nameless villain to justice.
The Druadan Forest is a wild and dangerous place. It is said that Woses, reclusive forest dwellers, still reside among the trees. You wonder if your quarry has considered the dangers of this course.
name: The Pursuit
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Dru-buri-Dru and set him aside, out of play. Shuffle the encounter deck.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

flavor:
As you move deeper into the forest, the wilderness quickly swallows all trace of civilization. Pushing through a dense patch of undergrowth, you came upon a dark and tangled grove. The scent of death strikes you.
In the grove, the fleeing traitors lie slain, pierced by poisoned arrows. As you search the pain-wracked corpses for the body of their leader, the ominous echo of drums begins to sound among the trees. You desperately begin to retrace your steps from the woods, lest the fate of the traitors becomes your own.
name: An Untimely End
text: Archery damage must be assigned to allies, if able.

flavor: You sense that the edge of the forest must be near at hand, but Woses are master huntsmen and a band of them block your path. your situation seems hopeless: there are simply too many of them. As they begin their attack, you realize your only hope of survival is to convince the Pukel-men that you are not their enemy.
name: The Passage Out
text:
When Revealed: Add Dru-buri-Dru to the staging area.
Siege. (Characters use their [Defense] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
Characters use their [Willpower] instead of [Attack] when attacking enemies. If an enemy would be damaged this way, place progress tokens on it instead of damage tokens. When an enemy has progress equal to its hit points, add it to the victory display and place those progress tokens on the quest.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Dru-buri-Dru
text:
Allies cannot defend against Dru-buri-Dru.
While Dru-buri-Dru is in the victory display, characters get +1 [Willpower] and +1 [Defense].
Unless Dru-buri-Dru is in the victory display, the players cannot win.

name: Drúadan Drummer
shadow_text: Shadow: Each Wose enemy engaged with the defending player gets +1 [Attack].
text: Each Wose enemy in the staging area gets +2 [Threat]

name: Druadan Elite
shadow_text: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.
text:
Archery 2. Prowl X.
X is the number of players in the game.

name: Drúadan Hunter
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 [Attack].
text:
Prowl 1. Archery X.
X is the number of heroes in play with no resources in their resource pool.

name: Druadan Thief
shadow_text: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after it attacks unless any player pays 1 resource.
text: Surge. Prowl 1.

flavor: "They still haunt the Druadan forest..." - Elfhelm, The Return of the King
name: Ancestral Clearing
text:
The cost to play each player card is increased by 1.
Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here.

flavor: "...they use poisoned arrows, it is said..." - Elfhelm, The Return of the King
name: Garden of Poisons
text:
Heroes cannot gain resources from card effects.
Travel: Each player must pay 1 resource to travel here.

flavor: "...they are woodcrafty beyond compare." - Elfhelm, The Return of the King
name: Glade of Cleansing
text:
Each Wose enemy gains archery 1.
X is equal to the total archery value of the highest archery Wose enemy in play.

name: Men in the Dark
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each hero the defending player controls with no resources.
text: When Revealed: Each hero must pay 1 resource or take 1 damage. If no hero takes damage from this effect, Men in the Dark gains surge.

name: Stars in Sky
shadow_text: Shadow: Discard all resources from the defending character's resource pool.
text:
Prowl 2.
When Revealed: Each questing hero must pay 1 resource or it is removed from the quest.

name: Leaves on Tree
shadow_text: Shadow: Discard an attachment from the defending character.
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Each player must pay 1 resource for each attachment he controls of discard all attachments he controls.

flavor: "There must be someone with intelligence in the party." <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Pippin
text: If each hero you control has the Hobbit trait, Pippin gains: "Response: After an enemy engages you, raise your threat by 3 to return it to the staging area. Until the end of the round, that enemy cannot engage you."

flavor: "Denethor is of another sort, proud and subtile, a man of far greater lineage and power, though he is not called a king." <cite>Gandalf, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Denethor
text:
Denethor gets -1 [willpower] for each damaged hero you control.
Discard Denethor if his [willpower] is 0 or less.

flavor: "The Captains of the Outlands are expected up the South Road ere sundown. Come with us and you will see." <cite>Bergil, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Lord of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor or Outlands hero. If each hero you control has a printed [leadership] resource icon, Lord of Morthond gains: "Response: After you play a [lore], [spirit], or [tactics] ally, draw 1 card."

name: Book of Eldacar
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Reduce the cost to play Book of Eldacar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [tactics] resource icon. Action: Discard Book of Eldacar to play any [tactics] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor: At last, less than a mile from the City, a more ordered mass of men came into view, marching not running, still holding together. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Gondorian Discipline
text: Response: Cancel up to 2 points of damage just dealt to a Gondor character.

name: Minas Tirith Lampwright
text: Response: After an encounter card with surge is revealed, discard Minas Tirith Lampwright to name enemy, location, or treachery. If the next encounter card revealed is the named type, discard it without resolving its effects.

name: Small Target
text: Response: After a Hobbit hero you control exhausts to defend an attack, choose another enemy engaged with you and reveal the attacking enemy's shadow card. If that shadow card has no shadow effect, resolve this enemy's attack against the chosen enemy. If that shadow card has a shadow effect, resolve this attack as normal.

name: Ithilien Archer
text: Ranged. Response: After Ithilien Archer attacks and damages an enemy, return that enemy to the staging area.

name: Ithilien Pit
text:
Play Ithilien Pit into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Ithilien Pit to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Any character may choose attached enemy as the target of an attack.

flavor:
They possessed from the first the art of disappearing swiftly and silently, when large folk whom they do not wish to meet come blundering by...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hobbit-sense
text: Play only if each of your heroes is a Hobbit. Combat Action: Enemies engaged with you do not attack this round. You cannot declare attacks this round.

flavor:
Emerging from the Druadan Forest with news of the conspirators' demise, you begin your journey to Minas Tirith. As you wake the following day, you see dark plumes of smoke rising across the lands of Anorien.

In a smoldering village near Amon Din, you find none other than a tired Lord Alcaron. Pleased to see you, he requests your assistance in protecting the village.
name: Savagery of the Orcs
text:
Setup: Set Ghulat aside, out of play. Put Lord Alcaron into play. Make Burning Farmhouse the active location. Add the Rescued Villagers and Dead Villagers objectives to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 encounter card per player and add it to the staging area.

Villagers 5.
When progress would be placed on Savagery of the Orcs, move an equal number of villager tokens from this quest onto Rescued Villagers instead.
If there are no villager tokens on Savagery of the Orcs, advance to the next stage.

flavor: The orcs pillaging Anorien are remnants of the army defeated at Cair Andros. Stranded on the western bank of the Anduin, They are now punishing the local population. One of the roving bands is led by a cunning orc captain by the name of Ghulat. You must stop Ghulat and his orcs, or many innocents will die...
name: Protect the Villagers
text:
When Revealed: Add Ghulat to the staging area.
If an attack goes undefended, discard X villager tokens from Rescued Villagers instead of damaging a hero. X is the amount of damage that would have been dealt.

When the players defeat this stage, end the game. Compare the number of tokens on Rescued Villagers to the number of tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Rescued Villagers
text:
If a location leaves play as an explored location, move any villager tokens from that location to Rescued VIllagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more villager tokens here than damage tokens on Dead Villagers, the players have won.

name: Dead Villagers
text:
If a villager token is discarded from a location, objective, or quest stage, place a damage token on Dead Villagers.

At the end of the game, if there are more damage tokens here than villager tokens on Rescued Villagers, the players have lost.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
Response: After a villager token is discarded, exhaust Lord Alcaron to place that villager token on a location instead.
If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Ghulat
text:
X is the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.
Forced: When Ghulat attacks, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.
While Ghulat is in play, the game cannot end.
Victory 2.

name: Marauding Orc
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.
text: Forced: After Marauding Orc attacks and destroys a character, place 1 damage token on Dead Villagers.

name: Orc Ravager
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. (+2 [Attack] instead if undefended.)
text: When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location. If no Villager token is discarded by this effect, Orc Ravager gains surge.

flavor: Eagles are not kindly birds. Some are cowardly and cruel. - The Hobbit
name: Craven Eagle
text: When Revealed: Discard the character with the fewest remaining hit points. That character's controller may discard 3 cards at random from his hand to prevent this effect.

flavor: Houses and barns were burning. - The Return of the King
name: Burning Farmhouse
text:
Villagers 4.
Forced: At the end of the round, discard 1 villager token from Burning Farmhouse.

Victory 1.

flavor: The townlands were rich, with wide tilth and many orchards... - The Return of the King
name: Gondorian Hamlet
text:
Villagers 3.
While Gondorian Hamlet is in the staging area it gains: "Forced: After a treachery card is revealed from the encounter deck, discard 1 villager token from Gondorian Hamlet."

Victory 1.

flavor: "...the herdsmen and husbandmen that dwelt there were not many..." - The Return of the King
name: Secluded Farmhouse
text:
Villagers 2.
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Victory 1.

name: Burnt Homestead
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each damage token on Dead Villagers.
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of damage tokens on Dead Villagers.

name: Trapped Inside
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard 1 villager token from Rescued Villagers.
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Discard 1 villager token from the active location for each player in the game. If no villager tokens were removed by this effect. Trapped Inside gains surge.

name: Panicked!
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each damage token on Dead Villagers.
text: When Revealed: Each player must take a villager token from Rescued VIllagers and place it on a location in the staging area, if able. If no villager tokens were placed on a location by this effect, Panicked! gains surge.

flavor: "The road may pass, but they shall not! Not while Faramir is Captain." <cite>Mablung, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Faramir
text:
Ranged.
Faramir gets +1 [attack] for each enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
The Morthond Valye made a great bay that beat up against the sheer southern faces of the mountains.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Sword of Morthond
text: Attach to a Gondor ally. Attached ally gains the Outlands trait.

flavor:
Death in the morning and at day's ending
lords took and lowly. Long now they sleep
under grass in Gondor by the Great River.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Men of the West
text: Action: Return X Outlands allies from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Knight of Minas Tirith
text: If each of your heroes has a printed [tactics] hero resource icon, Knight of Minas Tirith Tirith gains: "Response: After Knight of Minas Tirith enters play, choose an enemy in the staging area. Engage that enemy and exhaust Knight of Minas Tirith to declare it as attacker (and resolve its attack) against that enemy."

name: Gondorian Fire
text: Attach to a Gondor or Dúnedain hero. Action: Spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to give attached hero +1 [attack] for each resource in its resource pool until the end of the phase. (Limit once per phase.)

flavor:
"It is forty leagues and two from Pelargir to the landings at the Harlond..."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Pelargir Shipwright
text: Pelargir Shipwright gets +1 [willpower] for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] hero resource icon.

name: Map of Earnil
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero. Reduce the cost to play Map of Earnil by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. Action: Discard Map of Earnil to play any [spirit] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
Two had great bows, almost of their own height, and great quivers of long green-feathered arrows.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ranger Bow
text: Restricted. Attach to a Ranger character. Action: Exhaust Ranger Bow and attached character to deal 1 damage to an enemy in the staging area.

flavor: "For coming unbidden to this play death is our law." <cite>Anborn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Forest Patrol
text: Play only if you control at least 1 Ranger character. Action: Deal 3 damage to an enemy with at least 1 Trap card attached to it.

name: Palantir
text: Attach to a Noble hero. Planning Action: Exhaust Palantir and attached hero to name a card type and look at the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that matches the named type, draw a card. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, raise your threat by 2.

flavor: You have returned to Minas Tirith just in time to join the army of Gondor as it marches to Osgiliath. An army of orcs and southrons have garrisoned the ancient city, but Lord Boromir means to retake it. Eager to strike a blow against Mordor, you will see the city retaken or die in the attempt...
name: Retake the City
text:
Setup: Each player chooses 1 enemy and 1 unique location and add them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Player card effects cannot place progress tokens on locations in the staging area.

Forced: When an Osgiliath location leaves play as an explored location, the first player takes control of that location.

If the players control all Osgiliath locations in play at the end of the round, they have won the game.

name: Uruk Lieutenant
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls. (All attachments he controls instead if undefended.)
text: When Revealed: Add the topmost Orc enemy from the encounter discard pile to the staging area.

name: Uruk Soldier
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by 1 for each location he controls.
text: Forced: After Uruk Soldier attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller returns a location he controls to the staging area, if able.

name: Southron Phalanx
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each location the defending player controls.
text: While engaged with a player, Southron Phalanx gets +1 [Attack] for each location that player controls.

flavor: "...the Southrons were bold men and grim..." - The Return of the King
name: Southron Commander
text: When Revealed: Southron Commander makes an immediate attack from the staging area against each player who controls at least 1 location.

name: West Gate
text:
Action: If there is no active location, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an Osgiliath location, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Then, make West Gate the active location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Forced: After the player who controls West Gate lets an attack go undefended, return West Gate to the staging area.

flavor: "For that is the ruin of Osgiliath on either side of Anduin, which our enemies took and burned long ago." - Beregond, The Return of the King
name: The King's Library
text:
Travel: Reveal the top card of the encounter deck and add it to the staging area to travel here.

Forced: After the player who controls The King's Library lets an attack go undefended, return The King's Library to the staging area.

name: Ancient Harbor
text:
The players cannot travel here.

Combat Action: Exhaust a hero to place 1 progress token on Ancient Harbor.

Forced: After the player who controls Ancient Harbor lets an attack go undefended, return Ancient Harbor to the staging area.

name: The Old Bridge
text:
The players cannot travel here.
Planning Action: Spend 2 resources to place 1 progress token on The Old Bridge. (1 resource instead if there is another Osgiliath location in the staging area.)

Forced: After the player who controls The Old Bridge lets an attack go undefended, return The Old Bridge to the staging area.

name: West Quarter
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [Threat] to the staging area.
text: While West Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains siege. (Characters quest using [Defense] instead of [Willpower].)

name: East Quarter
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [Threat] to the staging area.
text: While East Quarter is the active location, the current quest gains battle. (Characters quest using [Attack] instead of [Willpower].)

name: Ruined Square
text:
Surge.

Response: After an enemy is defeated, place 1 progress token on Ruined Square.

Forced: If a player controls Ruined Square when a character leaves play, return Ruined Square to the staging area.

name: Ruined Tower
text:
Travel: If there is 1 active location, exhaust a character to travel here. (There are now 2 active locations.)

Forced: After the player who controls Ruined Tower loses control of a location, return Ruined Tower to the staging area.

name: Pinned Down
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character's controller must return a location he controls with the highest [Threat] to the staging area.
text: When Revealed: Add X to the archery total this round. X is the number of locations the players control. If the players control less than 4 locations, Pinned Down gains surge.

flavor: And now the fighting waxed furious... - The Return of the King
name: Street Fighting
text: When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an Osgiliath location is discarded. The first player may exhaust a hero to take control of that location. Otherwise, add that location to the staging area. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Counter-attack
text:
Surge.

When Revealed: Each player must return the location he controls with the highest [Threat] to the staging area, or raise his threat by the total [Threat] of all locations he controls.

flavor:
...there is no purpose higher in the world as it now stands than the good of Gondor...
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Caldara
text: Action: Discard Caldara to put 1 [spirit] ally from your discard pile into play for each other hero you control with a printed [spirit] resource icon. (Limit once per game.)

flavor:
As he spoke he struck a small silver gong that stood near his footstool, and at once servants came forward.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Squire of the Citadel
text: Response: After Squire of the Citadel leaves play, add 1 resource to a Gondor hero's resource pool.

name: Tome of Atanatar
text: Attach to a [leadership] hero. Reduce the cost to play Tome of Atanatar by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [leadership] resource icon. Action: Discard Tome of Atanatar to play any [leadership] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

name: Guthlaf
text: If there is at least 1 Rohan hero in play, lower the cost to play Guthlaf by 1. If there is at least 1 Gondor hero in play, Guthlaf gains sentinel.

flavor:
..we have this honour: ever we bear the brunt of the chief hatred of the Dark Lord, for that hatred comes down out of the of the depths of time and over the deeps of the Sea.
<cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: The Hammer-stroke
text: Encounter Action: Engage each enemy in play.

name: Emery
text: Action: Discard the top 3 card of your deck to put Emery into play from your hand, under any player's control. Then, if any of the discarded cards have the [tactics], [lore] or [leadership] sphere, discard Emery.

flavor:
"For deep in the hears of all my kindred lies the sea-longing, which it is perilous to stir"
<cite>Legolas, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Children of the Sea
text: Action: Choose a Silvan or Noldor ally you control. That ally gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase. At the end of the phase, shuffle that ally into its owner's deck if it is still in play.

flavor:
"I sent my keenest huntsmen to seek him, but he slipped them, and they had no sight of him till now, save Anborn."
<cite>Faramir, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Anborn
text: Action: Exhaust Anborn to return 1 Trap card from your discard pile to your hand.

name: Poisoned Stakes
text:
Play Poisoned Stakes into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Poisoned Stakes to the next eligble enemy that enters the staging area.
At the end of each round, deal 2 damage to attached enemy.

flavor:
Gimli the Dwarf alone wore openly a short shirt of steel-rings, for dwarves make light of burdens...
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Well-Equipped
text: Action: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. You may attach 1 attachment card discarded by this effect to an eligible Dwarf character in play.

flavor:
After the assault on Osgiliath, Lord Alcaron urges Boromir to pursue the retreating enemy. Boromir agrees and gives the mission to Faramir and his rangers. Grateful for your valiant efforts in Gondor’s defense, Faramir invites you to join the hunt...

You've pursued the enemy all the way to the Crossroads when a wicked horn blares in the distance. Within minutes, a host of orcs swarms out of the trees from all sides, led by a foreboding robed figure...
name: The Ambush
text:
Setup: Add The Crossroads and Black Númenorean to the staging area. Put the Faramir and Lord Alcaron objective allies into play. Shuffle the encounter deck and reveal 1 card from the encounter deck per player and add it to the staging area.

At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card. At the beginning of the combat phase, each player must turn each of his hidden cards faceup or take 1 hidden card.

flavor: Faramir and Lord Alcaron have been captured! Through the throng of warriors, you see their bloodied torn forms rushed eastward by a band of Uruks. You must move quickly to prevent the unthinkable! If there is to be any hope of rescuing your friends, you must first fight your way out of the ambush.
name: Captured!
text:
When Revealed: Place Faramir and Lord Alcaron under Captured! (they are in play but the players cannot gain control of them). Each player turns each of his hidden cards faceup.

Battle. (Characters use their [Attack] instead of [Willpower] when questing.)
At the beginning of the quest phase, each player takes 1 hidden card.
If a player has 5 hidden cards, he must turn them faceup.
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

name: Black Númenorean
text:
X is the total number of hidden cards in the game.
Forced: At the end of the round, each player must raise his threat by 1 for each hidden card in his play area.
Victory 3.

name: Orc Ambusher
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. (+3 [Attack] instead if undefended.)
text: Forced: After Orc Ambusher engages you, discard 1 non-objective ally you control, if able.

name: Brutal Uruk
text: Forced: After Brutal Uruk attacks and destroys a character, that character's controller turns all hidden cards in his play area faceup. Deal a shadow card to each enemy turned faceup by this effect and resolve their attacks as normal.

name: Evil Crow
shadow_text: Shadow: Take 1 hidden card.
text: Forced: When Evil Crow engages a player, that player takes 1 hidden card.

name: The Cross-roads
text:
The current quest card gains siege.
X is equal to the number of players in the game.
Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.
Victory 3.

flavor: This road, too, ran straight for a while, but soon it began to bend away southwards... –The Two Towers
name: Southern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

flavor: ...he saw, beyond an arch of boughs, the road to Osgiliath running almost as straight as a stretched ribbon down, down, into the West. –The Two Towers
name: Western Road
text:
Western Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area.
Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

flavor:
Behind them lay the road to the Morannon...
–The Two Towers
name: Northern Road
text: Travel: The first player must take 1 hidden card to travel here.

flavor: Black and forbidding it loomed above them, darker than the dark sky behind. –The Two Towers
name: Eastern Road
text:
Eastern Road gets +5 quest points while it is in the staging area.
Travel: The first player must take 2 hidden cards to travel here.

name: The Dark Woods
text:
Archery X.
X is the number of players in the game.
Forced: After The Dark Woods leaves play as an explored location, the first player discards 1 hidden card.

flavor: Up came the Orcs, yelling, with their long arms stretched out to seize him. – The Two Towers
name: Lying in Wait
text: When Revealed: The first player turns each hidden card in his play area faceup. Resolve the "When Revealed" effects of each encounter card turned faceup by this effect. If a location is turned faceup, add it to the staging area.

name: Mordor Looms
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, that character’s controller turns each of his hidden cards faceup.
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Each player takes 1 hidden card.

name: Conflict at the Crossroads
shadow_text: Shadow: Take 1 hidden card.
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, Orc enemies engaged with players add their [Threat] to the staging area. If no Orc enemies are engaged with players, Conflict at the Crossroads gains surge.

name: Faramir
text:
The first player gains control of Faramir.
Combat Action: Exhaust Faramir to turn a hidden card faceup. If that card is an enemy, deal 3 damage to it.
If Faramir leaves play, the players have lost the game.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
The first player gains control of Lord Alcaron.
Action: Exhaust Lord Alcaron to return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area.
If Lord Alcaron leaves play, the players have lost the game.

flavor: 'To me! To me!' cried Théoden. 'Up Eorlingas! Fear no darkness!' <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Théoden
text:
Sentinel.
Each [tactics] hero with a printed [tactics] resource icon gets +1 [willpower].

name: Pelargir Ship Captain
text: Response: After Pelargir Ship Captain enters play, move 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero you control to another hero's resource pool.

flavor: "...still the lords of Gondor have keener sight than lesser men..." <cite>Denethor, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Visionary Leadership
text: Attach to a Gondor hero. While attached hero has at least 1 resource in its resource pool, Gondor characters get +1 [willpower].

flavor: Right through the press drove Théoden Thengel's son, and his spear was shivered as he threw down thier chieftan. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Spear of the Mark
text: Restricted. Attach to a Rohan character. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if attacking an enemy in the staging area).

flavor: "Oaths ye have taken: now fulfill them all, to lord and land and league of friendship!" <cite>Théoden, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Forth Eorlingas!
text: Combat Action: Each Rohan hero can be declared as an attacker against enemies in the staging area this phase.

flavor: ...fresh horses were always in readiness to bear his errand-riders to Rohan in the Noth... <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Steed of the Mark
text: Attach to a Gondor or Rohan hero. Response: after attached hero commits to a quest, spend 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to ready attached hero.

flavor:
An Elven-maid there was of old.
A shining star by day:
Her mantle white was hemmed with hold,
Her shoes of silver-grey.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Lay of Nimrodel
text: Action: Choose a [spirit] hero. Until the end of the phase, that hero gets +1 [willpower] for each resource in its resource pool.

name: Ered Nimrais Prospector
text: Response: After Ered Nimrais Prospector enters play, discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, choose and shuffle 1 card from your discard pile back into your deck.

name: Scroll of Isildur
text: Attach to a [lore] hero. Reduce the cost to play Scroll of Isildur by 1 for each hero you control with a printed [lore] resource icon. Action: Discard Scroll of Isildur to play any [lore] event card in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Then, place that event on the bottom of your deck.

flavor:
...there was a good deal of food jumbled carlessly on shelves and on the ground, among an untidy litter of plunder...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Hidden Cache
text: Response: After Hidden Cache is discarded from your deck, add 2 resources to the resource pool of a hero you control. Action: Spend 1 resource to draw 1 card.

flavor:
Lord Alcaron and Faramir have been captured by forces from Minas Morgul. You pursue their captors eastward into the dreaded vale.
You are betrayed! Lord Alcaron has revealed himself as in league with the Enemy. A large Uruk, Murzag, has been left in charge of finishing you off while Faramir is rushed ahead to the Dead City.
name: The Rearguard
text:
Setup: Set aside Lord Alcaron, Nazgûl of Minas Morgul, and The White Bridge. Add To the Tower, Murzag, and 1 copy of Morgul Vale to the staging area.
Murzag cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Murzag is defeated, advance to the next stage.

flavor:
You’ve defeated the great Murzag and his kin. There is no time for rest as you follow Faramir deeper into the vale. Soon you find the traitor Alcaron blocking the road, a grimace of anger on his formerly handsome face. “By the thousand thorn-drakes of Morgai, you do tempt my patience!” he sneers.
Alcaron utters an ancient word, and a ghastly shriek rises from Minas Morgul. Something cold and terrible has awoken. Something that is aware of your presence. A short distance ahead, the Uruk carrying Faramir pauses, intimidated by the carrion cry from the city. There may still be time. But first you must deal with the traitor...
name: The Betrayal
text:
When Revealed: Add Lord Alcaron to the staging area.
Lord Alcaron cannot leave play unless destroyed. If Lord Alcaron is defeated, advance to the next stage.

flavor: You’ve delivered justice to the traitor Alcaron. You rush forward to help Lord Faramir, who is still struggling with his captors. Then another shrill cry emanates from the city. It pierces your ears and chills your heart. With a dull clangor, the gates to Minas Morgul open. Mounted on a great black horse, a Nazgûl rides forth to claim Sauron’s prize.
name: The Morgul Rider
text:
When Revealed: Add Nazgûl of Minas Morgul and The White Bridge to the staging area.
When Revealed: Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.
Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot leave play unless destroyed.
If Nazgûl of Minas Morgul is defeated, the players have won the game.

name: To the Tower
text:
To the Tower cannot leave the staging area.
Remove Faramir from the game.
If 10 or more progress tokens are on To the Tower, the players have lost the game.

name: Morgul Bodyguard
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy engages the next player and makes an immediate attack, if able.
text: Any damage that would be dealt to a Captain enemy is dealt to 1 Morgul Bodyguard instead.

flavor: Shadow: Defending player must place 1 progress token on To the Tower or treat this attack as undefended.
name: Morgul Sorcerer
text: Forced: After any number of progress tokens are placed on To the Tower, deal Morgul Sorcerer a shadow card.

name: Morgul Tracker
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. If undefended, place 1 progress token on To the Tower as well.
text: Forced: When Morgul Tracker is optionally engaged, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: Murzag
text: Forced: After Murzag attacks, reveal the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, put it into play engaged with the defending player.

name: Lord Alcaron
text:
Forced: When Lord Alcaron attacks, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
Forced: When Lord Alcaron is dealt a shadow card with no shadow effect, he makes an additional attack after this one (deal and resolve another shadow card).

flavor:
"Come not between the Nazgûl and his prey!"
–The Witch King, The Return of the King
name: Nazgûl of Minas Morgul
text:
Nazgûl of Minas Morgul cannot have attachments.
Reduce any amount of damage dealt to Nazgûl of Minas Morgul to 1.

name: Morgul Road
shadow_text: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.
text: Response: After Morgul Road leaves play as an explored location, the first player may remove 1 progress token from To the Tower or deal 1 damage to an enemy in play.

name: Morgul Vale
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, place 1 progress token on To the Tower.
text: Forced: At the end of the round, each player returns 1 enemy engaged with him to the staging area.

flavor: So they came slowly to the white bridge. -The Two Towers
name: The White Bridge
text: X is the number of progress tokens on To the Tower.

flavor: The air above was heavy with fog, and a reek lay on the land about them. –The Two Towers
name: Impenetrable Fog
text: When Revealed: The first player places 3 progress tokens on To the Tower or reveals X additional cards from the encounter deck and adds them to the staging area. X is the number of players in the game.

name: Sleepless Malice
shadow_text: Shadow: Return attacking enemy to the staging area after this attack.
text:
Doomed 2.
When Revealed: Each player must discard 3 random cards from his hand or place 1 progress token on To The Tower.

name: Terror Drives Them
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each progress token on To the Tower.
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Place 1 progress token on To the Tower.

name: The Dead City Looms
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each progress token on To the Tower.
text: When Revealed: Raise each player's threat by the number of progress tokens on To the Tower. If there are no progress tokens on To the Tower, The Dead City Looms gains surge.

flavor: "I am named Éomer son of Éomund, and am called the Third Marshal of Riddermark." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Éomer
text: Response: After a character leaves play, Éomer gets +2 [attack] until the end of the round. (Limit once per round.)

flavor: "Let your counsellor Gríma keep all things till your return – and I pray that we may see it, though no wise man will deem it hopeful." <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Gríma
text: Action: Lower the cost of the next card you play from your hand this round by 1. That card gains Doomed 1. (Limit once per round.)

name: Saruman
text: Doomed 3. At the end of the round, discard Saruman from play. Response: After Saruman enters play, choose a non-unique enemy or location in the staging area. While Saruman is in play, the chosen enemy or location is considered to be out of play.

flavor: "...the keepers of the gate were on the watch for me and told me that Saruman awaited me." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Orthanc Guard
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, ready Orthanc Guard.

flavor: "I have an urgent errand," he said. "My news is evil." <cite>Radagast, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Isengard Messenger
text: Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, Isengard Messenger gets +1 [willpower] until the end of the round. (Limit twice per round.)

flavor: "Erkenbrand of Westfold has drawn off those men he could gather towards his fastness at Helm's Deep. The rest are scattered." <cite>Rider of Rohan, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Westfold Outrider
text: Action: Discard Westfold Outrider to choose an enemy not engaged with you. Engage the chosen enemy.

flavor: "They love their horses next to their kin." <cite>Boromir, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Westfold Horse-breeder
text: Response: After Westfold Horse-breeder enters play, search the top 10 cards of your deck for a Mount attachment and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: Their horses were of great stature, strong and clean-limbed... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Rohan Warhorse
text: Attach to a [tactics] or Rohan hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero participates in an attack that destroys an enemy, exhaust Rohan Warhorse to ready attached hero.

flavor: ...one of them uncovered a small lamp that gave out a slender silver beam. <cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Silver Lamp
text:
Attach to a [spirit] hero.
While attached hero is ready, shadow cards dealt to enemies engaged with you are dealt face up. (Shadow card effects are still resolved when resolving enemy attacks.)

flavor: "He has the Key of Orthanc" <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Keys of Orthanc
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After you raise your threat from the Doomed keyword, exhaust Keys of Orthanc to add 1 resource to attached hero's resource pool.

flavor: "...in the midst of that valley is a tower of stone called Orthanc. It was not made by Saruman, but by the Men of Númenor long ago: and it is very tall and has many secrets..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Legacy of Númenor
text: Doomed 4. Action: Add 1 resource to each hero's resource pool.

flavor: "His knowledge is deep, but his pride has grown with it..." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Deep Knowledge
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player draws 2 cards.

flavor: ...it was a delight to hear the voice speaking, all that it said seemed wise and reasonable... <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: The Wizards's Voice
text: Doomed 3. Action: Each player chooses 1 enemy engaged with him. Until the end of the phase, each chosen enemy cannot attack the player that chose it.

flavor: "But Saruman has long studied the arts of the Enemy himself, and thus we have often been able to forestall him." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Power of Orthanc
text: Doomed 2. Action: Each player may choose and discard a Condition attachment from play.

flavor: "...alone it could do nothing but see small images of things far off and days remote." <cite>Gandalf, The Two Towers</cite>
name: The Seeing-stone
text: Doomed 1. Action: Search your deck for a card with the Doomed keyword and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

flavor: Behind him cringing between two other men, came Gríma the Wormtongue. –The Two Towers
name: Gríma
text:
If free of encounters, the first player gains control of Gríma.
Action: Exhaust Gríma to draw a card.
If Gríma leaves play, the players lose the game.

flavor: There were three lines of flat stepping-stones across the stream, and between them fords for horses, that went from either brink to a bare eyot in the midst. –The Two Towers
name: The Islet
text:
Immune to player card effects.
While The Islet is the active location, each Dunland enemy in play gets +1 [Threat].
Victory 1.

flavor: The road dipped between rising turf-banks, carving its way through the terraces to the river's edge, and up again upon the further side. –The Two Towers
name: Fords of Isen
text:
While Fords of Isen is in the staging area, players cannot gain resources from card effects.
Forced: After Fords of Isen becomes the active location, each player with fewer than 5 cards in his hand draws cards until he has 5 in his hand.

name: The King's Road
text:
While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gets +3 quest points.
While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, The King's Road gains: "When faced with the option to travel, the players must travel to The King's Road, if able."

name: Gap of Rohan
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.
text: While Gap of Rohan is in the staging area, Dunland enemies get +1 [Attack].

name: Pillaging and Burning
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls (each attachment he controls instead if this attack is undefended).
text: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player raises his threat by 1 for each card in his hand.

name: Down from the Hills
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: Either remove 1 time counter from the current quest, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy, reveal it, and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. If any player has 5 or more cards in hand, this effect cannot be canceled.

flavor: "Troubles follow you like crows, and ever the oftener the worse." –Gríma, The Two Towers
name: Ill Tidings
text: When Revealed: The first player draws this card into his hand. Ill Tidings cannot leave that player's hand. Then, if the first player has 5 or more cards in his hand, Ill Tidings gains surge.

name: Mugash
text:
Cannot have attachments.
Forced: After Mugash is defeated, the first player attaches him to a hero he controls and exhausts that hero. (Counts as a Captive attachment with the text: "Attached hero cannot ready. If attached hero leaves play, the players lose the game.")

name: Mugash's Guard
text:
While a player controls a hero with Mugash attached, Mugash's Guard engages that player.
Forced: After Mugash's Guard destroys a character, if Mugash is attached to a hero, return Mugash to the staging area.
Victory 3.

name: Methedras Orc
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.
text: Forced: When Methedras Orc attacks, the defending player shuffles 1 random card from his hand into his out-of-play deck.

flavor: Beyond there glimmered far away, as if floating on a grey cloud, the white head of tall Methedras, the last peak of the Misty Mountains. –The Two Towers
name: Methedras
text:
While Methedras is the active location, each location in the staging area gets +1 [Threat].
Forced: When Methedras leaves play as an explored location, each player Searches 3.

name: Orc Cave
text:
Forced: After Orc Cave leaves play as an explored location, the first player Searches 5.
Travel: Discard the top X cards of the encounter deck to travel here. X is the number of players in the game. Add each Orc enemy discarded this way to the staging area.

name: Mugash's Lair
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player discards an attachment he controls.
text: Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, reveal the top card of each player's out-of-play deck. Add each revealed enemy to the staging area and discard the rest.

name: Orc Territory
text: When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a location and adds it to the staging area. If the total [Threat] in the staging area is less than the total [Willpower] of all characters committed to the quest, each Orc enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack.

name: Mugash
text:
Guarded.
Action: Exhaust a hero to claim this objective when it is free of encounters. Attach Mugash to that hero.
Forced: After attached hero takes damage, return Mugash to the top of the encounter deck.

flavor:
"...we are on the very edge of Fangorn, and it is perilous to touch the trees of that wood, it is said."
–Aragorn, The Two Towers
name: Edge of Fangorn
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and add it to the staging area to travel here (2 Huorn enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game).
Victory 1.

flavor: "There is a great power in them, and they seem able to wrap themselves in shadow..." –Merry, The Two Towers
name: Dark-Hearted Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must raise his threat by 2.

flavor: "I should be terrified of meeting them, if there were no true Ents about to look after them." –Merry, The Two Towers
name: Angry Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, Angry Huorn attacks the engaged player.

flavor: "We could not see them, of course, but the whole air was full of creaking." –Merry, The Two Towers
name: Deadly Huorn
text:
Hinder. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the beginning of each resource phase, the engaged player must deal 3 damage to a character he controls.

name: Heart of Fangorn
shadow_text: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.
text:
While Heart of Fangorn is in the staging area, each player cannot refresh more than 5 characters during the refresh phase.
.

name: The Forest's Malice
text: When Revealed: Each Huorn enemy engaged with a player makes an immediate attack. If no attack was made as a result of this effect, each player must search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and put it into play engaged with him. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Orc Skirmisher
shadow_text: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack].
text: Forced: After Orc Skirmisher engages a player, that player must either deal 3 damage to a character he controls, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Orc Hunter
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.
text: When Revealed: Either reveal an additional encounter card, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Orc Hound
text:
Surge.
Forced: After Orc Hound engages a player, that player must exhaust a character he controls.

flavor: 'The scouts have come back at last,' said an Orc close at hand. -The Two Towers
name: Orc Hunting Party
text: When Revealed: Deal each Orc enemy in play a shadow card. Each Orc enemy gets -15 engagement cost until the end of the round. If there are no Orc enemies in the staging area, Orc Hunting Party gains surge.

flavor: ...the wild men of the Dunland fells. -The Two Towers
name: Dunland Prowler
text: While any player has 3 or more cards in hand, Dunland Prowler gains surge. While any player has 5 or more cards in hand, Dunland Powler gets +1 Threat.

name: Dunlending Bandit
shadow_text: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead if the defending player has at least 3 cards in his hand)-
text: While engaged with a player, Dunlending Bandit gets +1 [Attack] for each card in that player's hand.

name: Dunland Raider
shadow_text: Discard an attachment you control-
text: Forced: After Dunland Raider engages a player, that player must deal X damage divided among characters he controls where X equals the number of cards in his hand.

flavor: “They hate us, and they are glad; for our doom seems certain to them.” –Gamling, The Two Towers
name: Old Hatreds
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the current quest.
(Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, raise his threat by 1.")

name: Dunland Tribesman
shadow_text: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack].
text:
When Revealed: Each player draws a card.

Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, Dunland Tribesman gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the round.

name: Dunland Chieftain
text: Forced: After Dunland Chieftain engages a player, discard X cards from the top of the encounter deck where X is the number of cards in the engages player's hand. Put the topmost Dunland enemy discarded this way into play engaged with that player.

name: Dunland Berserker
shadow_text: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack after this one.
text: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards. Dunland Berserker makes an immediate attack.

flavor: "I looked on the hillmen and they seemed over large for me..." -Gimli, The Two Towers
name: Wild Men of Dunland
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to the current quest. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, that player deals 1 damage to a character he controls.")

name: Ancient Forest
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.
text: While Ancient Forest is in the staging area, each Forest location in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] and +3 quest points. This ability does not stack with other copies of Ancient Forest.

flavor: The forest was dark and close. -The Two Towers
name: Tangled Woods
text: While Tangled Woods is in the staging area, each Forest location in plays gains: "Travel: Exhaust a hero to travel here." This ability does not stack with other copies of Tangled Woods.

name: Turned Around
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, return the active location to the staging area.
text: When Revealed: Either remove 1 time counter from a card in play, or return the active location to the staging area.

name: Prowling Wolf
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player exhausts a character he controls.
text: While engaged with a player, Prowling Wolf gets +1 [Attack] for each location in the staging area.

name: Broken Lands
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] for each location in the staging area.
text: While Broken Lands is in the staging area, progress cannot be placed on locations in the staging area.

flavor: Out of the darkness arrows whistled. -The Two Towers
name: Take Cover!
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Either deal 1 damage to each exhausted character, or remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

name: Low on Provisions
shadow_text: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead if the defending character is undamaged.)
text: When Revealed: Each player must assign X damage among characters he controls, where X is the number of characters he controls.

name: Off Track
text:
Surge.
When Revealed: Attach to a location in play. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 quest points and Gain: 'Forced: Remove an additional time counter from the current quest at the end of each refresh phase, if able.'")

flavor:
I have just about enough strength left to find some hole away up there. And then I must rest a little.
-Frodo, The Return of the King
name: In Need of Rest
text: When Revealed: Remove a hero from the quest and attach In Need of Rest to that hero. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Limit 1 per hero. Forced: After a time counter is removed from the current quest, attached hero takes 1 damage.")

flavor: Riding north to the Gap of Rohan, you come upon a battle at the Fords of Isen. A Small number of Rohirrim have taken a defensive position, on the islet in the river's center where a large force of wild Dunlending assails them. You must move swifty lest the river run red with blood of Rohan...
name: Fight at the Fords
text:
Setup: Add The Islet to the staging area and attach Gríma to that location. Each player searches the encounter deck for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 5. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard Gríma from play.

The players cannot advance unless the first player controls Gríma.

flavor: After driving the Wild Men back from the islet, you are surprised to find king Théoden's personal advisor, Gríma Wormtongue, among the men defending the fords. He tells you that he was on his way to Isengard when he was caught in the attack. Before he can say more of his errand, the Dunlendings redouble their assault. "Save me!" Gríma cries as he shrinks behind you. The life of the king's counselor is in your hands...
name: Dunlending Attack
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player assigns X damage among characters he controls where X is the number of cards in his hand. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

flavor: The Dunlendings' assault is relentless and your arms grow weary. "Take me to Isengard!" Gríma pleads, but you will not abandon the defense. You will either break the will of the enemy, or give your life in a heroic last stand...
name: Hold the Fords
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 different Dunland enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top X cards from the encounter deck. X is the number of cards in the first player's hand. Add each enemy discarded this way to the staging area. Put 3 time counters on this stage.

While there is at least 1 enemy in play, the players cannot defeat this stage. If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

flavor:
Saruman has tasked you with a dangerous mission: journey up the Misty Mountains' southern peack in search of the Orc, Mugash, and capture him alive.

Mugash and his Orcs have been raiding the surrounding coutryside from their hidden lair in Methedras, and carrying loot and captives back into the mountains. It's time to put an end to this menace...
name: Orders from Orthanc
text:
Setup: Each player removes the top 20 cards of his deck and places them aside, as an out-of-play deck. The first player takes Mugash plus 1 Mugash's Guard for each other player in the game and randomly shuffles one facedown into each player's out-of-play deck. Place any remaining copies of Mugash's Guard aside, out of play.

When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck for a Mountain location and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Then, advance to stage 2.

flavor: Orcs prowl the mountainside on the lookout for intruders. A single horn-call from one of the sentries would have every Orc in Methedras scurrying out of their holes to fight. You must move carefully to avoid detection while you search for their captain...
name: Searching for Mugash
text:
Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed for this stage, shuffle the discard pile into the encounter deck and reveal 2 encounter cards per player. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

Response: After questing successfully, cancel all progress that would be placed on this stage. Then, place 1 time counter on this stage. Or, if Mugash is in play, advance to stage 3.

flavor: You've found Mugash, but the Orc captain won't be taken without a fight! He howls and rages against you with the ferocity of a cornered animal. All the commotion is sure to draw more Orcs to the fray, yet you must subdue the huge Uruk before you can retreat down the mountain...
name: The Wizard's Prize
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, return Mugash to the staging area and reveal X encounter cards. X is the number of players in the game minus 1. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Progress cannot be placed on this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

flavor:
You've captured the Orc captain, Mugash, in the mountains above Isengard. But as you make your way down Methedras, your captive escaped and flees east into Fangorn.

You pursue Mugash into the ancient forest to find that the trees themselves seems to be attacking him. Without thinking, your at the tree branches to rescue your captive. That is when you first sense your own peril...
name: Into the Woods
text:
Setup: Add Edge of Fangorn to the staging area and attach Mugash to that location. Shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal X additional encounter cards where X equals the number of players in the game minus 1.

Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3.

The players cannot advance to stage 2 unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

flavor: You've rescued Mugash from the trees, but your sense the forest itself seethes with anger toward you. The thankless Orc struggles against you and the tree branches grasp at you. It's going to be a hard fight to get out of Fangorn with your captive...
name: Escape from Fangorn
text:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Huorn enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Time 4. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, shuffle Mugash into the encounter deck and advance to stage 3A.

The players cannot defeat this stage unless Mugash is attached to a hero.

If the players defeat this stage, they win the game.

flavor: Mugash has disappeared deeper into the woods. As you continue to search for him, the trees close in around you and you can feel their roots and limbs shaking with anger. Their branches rattle like a raging temptest, but without any wind. You're beginning to regret the decision to enter Fangorn. You need to find Mugash and get out...
name: The Angry Forest
text:
Time 3. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. Each player must choose an enemy or objective in the discard pile, reveal it and add it to the staging area. Place 3 time counters on this stage.

Forced: After placing progress here, if there is at least 6 progress on this stage and Mugash is attached to a hero, advance to stage 2A.

flavor: "...the lord of the Galadhrim is accounted wisest of the Elves of Middle-earth, and a giver of gifts beyond the power of kings." <cite>Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Celeborn
text: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.
