name: Mirkwood Explorer
text: Response: After Mirkwood Explorer quests successfully, place 1 progress on it. Action: Exhaust Mirkwood Explorer to move all progress from it to a location in play.

flavor:
"In this high play you may see the two powers that are opposed to one another; and ever they strive now in thought..."
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Guarded Ceaselessly
text: Attach to a location. Action: Exhaust a Ranger or Scout character to give attached location -2 [threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Take the Ship!
text:
Setup: Build the encounter deck using only The Stormcaller and Corsair Raiders encounter sets, setting The Thing in the Depths and The Stormcaller Elite encounter sets aside, out of play (enemy side faceup). Search the encounter deck for Helm of the Stormcaller and 1 copy of Umbar Raider, and add them to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah gain indestructible.
Forced: At the end of the round, if Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah are not in play, add 1 resource to each of them.
Progress cannot be placed on this stage unless Helm of the Stormcaller is in the victory display.

name: Change of Plans
text: When Revealed: Flip Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah to their objective sides, removing all tokens from them. Search the encounter deck, discard pile and all play areas for each encounter card from the Corsair Raiders encounter set and remove each of those cards from the game. Add The Thing in the Depths to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set aside The Thing in the Depths encounter set into the encounter deck. Advance to stage 3.

name: Defend the Ship!
text:
When Revealed: Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until X Tentacle enemies are discarded, where X is 1 more than the number of players in the game. Resolve the Grapple keyword on each of those enemies.

During the travel phase, the players may travel to a location in the staging area even if another location is currently active. If they do, return the currently active location to the staging area.
At the end of the round, if the total [Threat] of any one Ship location is 9 or higher, the Stormcaller is destroyed, and the players lose the game.
When Thing in the Depths is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: Helm of the Stormcaller
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Helm of the Stormcaller gets +1 quest point for each resource token on a Raider enemy in play.
Forced: When Helm of the Stormcaller becomes the active location, add Captain Sahír and Na’asiyah to the staging area from out of play (enemy side faceup).

name: Forecastle Deck
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead if defending character has no resources on it or in its resource pool).
text: Forced: After you travel to Forecastle Deck, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and reveal it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Weather Deck
shadow_text: Shadow: Exhaust a character you control.
text: While Weather Deck is in the staging area, each other Deck location in play gains “Travel: Each player must exhaust a character he controls to travel here.”

name: Cargo Hold
shadow_text: Shadow: Until the end of the phase, attacking enemy gets +2 [Defense].
text: While Cargo Hold is the active location, each enemy gets +1 [Defense].

name: Crew Quarters
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +2 [Attack].
text: Travel: Add 1 resource to each Raider card in play to travel here.

name: Quarter Deck
shadow_text: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.
text: While Quarter Deck is the active location, deal each enemy an additional shadow card at the beginning of the combat phase.

name: Hold Steady!
shadow_text: Shadow: If the defending character has 0 [Defense], discard it. Otherwise, the defending character gets –2 [Defense] for this attack.
text: When Revealed: Exhaust each character with 1 or less [Defense].

name: The Thing in the Depths
text:
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged.
The Thing in the Depths gets +3 hit points per player.
Forced: When a Creature enemy is destroyed, deal damage to The Thing in the Depths equal to that enemy’s [Threat].

name: Eye of the Beast
text:
Surge.
Eye of the Beast cannot attack.
While Eye of the Beast is engaged with a player, The Thing in the Depths attacks that player during the combat phase (deal and resolve a shadow card for this attack).

name: Thrashing Arm
text:
Grapple (lowest printed [Threat]).
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, if Thrashing Arm is engaged with you, deal 3 damage to a character you control.

name: Crushing Arm
text:
Surge. Grapple (highest printed quest points).
Forced: After Crushing Arm is detached from a location, it makes an immediate attack against the first player.

name: Grasping Arm
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack is undefended, resolve Grasping Arm’s Grapple keyword.
text:
Grapple (highest printed [Threat]).
Forced: When Grasping Arm attacks, the engaged player must exhaust a character he controls.

name: Giant Arm
shadow_text: Shadow: After this attack, either put Giant Arm into play engaged with you and deal it a shadow card, or resolve its Grapple ability.
text:
Grapple (loewst printed quest points).
Giant Arm gets +2 [Attack] when attacking allies.

name: From the Depths
shadow_text: Shadow: Assign damage among characters you control equal to the number of enemies grappled with locations in the staging area.
text: When Revealed: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Resolve the Grapple keyword on each enemy discarded by this effect.

name: Lashing Tentacles
shadow_text: Shadow: After this attack, The Thing in the Depths makes an attack against the defending player (deal a shadow card for this attack).
text: When Revealed: The Thing in the Depths attacks each player in turn order from the staging area (deal and resolve a shadow card for each attack).

flavor: Ahead nearer the walls Elfhelm's men were among the siege-engines, hewing, slaying, driving their foes into the fire-pits. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Elfhelm
text: Each [spirit] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [willpower]. Each [tactics] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [attack]. Each [leadership] hero with an attached Mount gets +1 [defense].

flavor:
He drew himself up. Then he knelt, offering his notched sword to the king. "Command me, lord!" he cried. 
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ceorl
text: Spend 1 [spirit] resource to ready Ceorl. Then, you may give control of Ceorl to another player. Any player may trigger this action. (Limit once per phase).

name: Armored Destrier
text: Attach to a [leadership] or sentinel hero. Restricted. Response: After attached hero defends against an attack, exhaust Armored Destrier to ready attached hero. Then, discard a shadow card from another enemy engaged with the defending player.

name: Déorwine
text: Sentinel. Action: While Déorwine is defending, spend 1 [leadership] resource to cancel a shadow effect dealt to the attacking enemy. Any player may trigger this action.

flavor: "…seeing an Elf-lord revealed in his wrath, they were dismayed, and their horses were stricken with madness." <cite>Gandalf, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Revealed in Wrath
text: Play only if you control a Noldor hero. Action: Choose a non-unique enemy. Until the end of the phase, treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

name: Rhovanion Outrider
text: Response: After Rhovanion Outrider commits to the quest, place 1 progress on a location in the staging area. If that location is not explored by this effect, give Rhovanion Outrider +1 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Scouting Party
text: Response: After you commit characters to the quest, if each character you have committed to the quest is a Scout, each of those characters gets +2 [willpower] until the end of the phase.

name: Entangling Nets
text:
Play Entangling Nets into the staging area unattached.
If unattached, attach Entangling Nets to the next eligible enemy that enters the staging area.
Attached enemy gets –2 [attack] and –2 [defense].

name: Arrows from the Trees
text: Play only after making engagement checks. Encounter Action: If no enemies were engaged this phase, deal 1 damage to each enemy in the staging area. Then, the players as a group may spend 3 [tactics] resources to deal 2 additional damage to each enemy in the staging area.

flavor:
Tools were to be found in plenty that the miners and quarriers and builders of old had used; and at such work the dwarves were still very skilled.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Ered Luin Miner
text: Response: After Ered Luin Miner is discarded from the top of your deck, put it into play under your control.

name: Searching the Island
text:
Setup: Prepare the Island Map (see insert). Flip over the top-left and bottom-left locations of the Island Map (without resolving their Forced effects, if any), and choose one as the players’ starting active location, using a resource token to represent which location is active. The first player takes control of Captain Sahír, and the last player takes control of Na’asiyah (objective-ally sides faceup). Add Temple Guardian to the staging area and attach Gate Key to it, guarded. Shuffle the encounter deck.

Exploration.
For each progress that would be placed on Searching the Island, you may place it on a location in the staging area, instead.

name: The Grotto’s Entrance
text:
Forced: When The Grotto’s Entrance is flipped over while active, put Temple Guardian into play from the victory display, engaged with the player with the highest threat.
When the 8th progress is placed on The Grotto’s Entrance, the players have found the sunken ruins and win the game.

name: Temple Halls
text:
While Temple Halls is the active location, each character gets –1 [Attack] and –1 [Defense].
Forced: When Temple Halls is flipped over while active, put Temple Guardian into play from the victory display, engaged with the player with the highest threat.

name: Temple Guardian
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
Immune to player card effects. Cannot be optionally engaged.
Temple Guardian gets –50 engagement cost while Cursed Temple is the active location.

name: Gate Key
text:
If unattached, return Gate Key to the staging area and it gains: “Action: Exhaust a hero to claim Gate Key and attach it to that hero.”
Action: Exhaust Gate Key and attached hero and spend 3 resources from attached hero’s resource pool to look at the facedown side of a Temple of the Deceived.

name: Jagged Cliffs
text:
While Jagged Cliffs is the active location, the location to its right is not considered to be in the staging area.
Forced: When Jagged Cliffs is flipped over while active, look at the facedown side of each adjacent copy of Lost Island.

name: Winding Caverns
text:
While Winding Caverns is the active location, each enemy gets +10 engagement cost.
When you would travel from Winding Caverns to another location, you may travel to a location up to 3 locations away. (You must still pay that location’s Travel cost in order to travel there.)

name: Jungle Path
text:
While Jungle Path is the active location, the locations immediately above and below it are not considered to be in the staging area.
Forced: When Jungle Path is flipped over while active, each player must exhaust a character with at least 2 [Attack].

name: Faithless Desecrator
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead of the active location is a Ruins location).
text: While engaged with a player, Faithless Desecrator contributes its [Threat] to the total [Threat] in the staging area.

name: Island Watcher
text:
Island Watcher cannot be optionally engaged.
While Island Watcher is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, if the active location has the Ruins trait, Island Watcher engages the player with the highest threat. Then, deal it 2 shadow cards.”

name: Profane Dead
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +3 [Attack] if the players control the Gate Key.
text: Forced: When you travel to the right, Profane Dead makes an immediate attack against the engaged player.

name: Deeper into the Ruins
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the phase, add X [Threat] to the total [Threat] in the staging area. X is the total [Threat] of all locations to the left of the active location (in its row). If X is 0, Deeper into the Ruins gains Doomed 1.

name: Furious Rainstorm
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, raise your threat by the attacking enemy’s [Threat].
text: When Revealed: Each player must choose: raise his threat by the number of his characters committed to the quest, or deal 1 damage to each of his characters committed to the quest.

name: Dwindling Supplies
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending character gets -2 [Defense] for this attack.
text: When Revealed: Each player must randomly discard cards from his hand until he has no more than 3 cards in his hand. If no cards were discarded by this effect, Dwindling Supplies gains doomed 2.

name: Sunken Ruins
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Each Uncharted location in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the phase. If the active location has the Ruins trait, discard 1 resource from each hero and objective ally in play.

name: Argalad
text: Ranged. Action: Exhaust Argalad to choose an enemy in the staging area. Until the end of the phase, that enemy gets -X [threat], where X is Argalad's [attack]. If this effect reduces the enemy's [threat] to 0, deal 1 damage to it. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
...he did not altogether approve of dwarves and their love of gold...
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Dwarven Sellsword
text: Forced: At the end of the round, discard Dwarven Sellsword unless the players as a group spend 1 [leadership] resource.

name: Dúnedain Remedy
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After Dúnedain Remedy is attached to a hero, heal 1 damage on that hero. Action: Pay 1 resource from attached hero's resource pool to attach Dúnedain Remedy to another hero.

flavor:
"Keen are the eyes of the Elves."
<cite>Aragorn, The Two Towers</cite>
name: Marksman of Lórien
text: Ranged. Response: After Marksman of Lórien enters play, choose an enemy. That enemy gets -2 [defense] until the end of the round.

flavor:
Fey he seemed, or the battle-fury of his fathers ran like new fire in his veins...
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Battle-fury
text: Play only before the staging step. Quest Action: Exhaust a hero you control to immediately declare it as an attacker (and resolve its attack) against any eligible enemy target. Then, the players as a group may spend 1 [spirit] resource to commit that hero to the quest.

name: Woodland Courier
text: Response: After Woodland Courier enters play, place 1 progress on a location (2 progress instead if that location has the Forest trait).

flavor:
He made his end of the rope fast about another tree, and then ran lightly along it, over the river and back again, as if he were on a round.
<cite>The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Hithlain
text: Attach to a location. Limit 1 per location Response: After a player plays a Silvan ally from his hand, place 1 progress on attached location.

flavor:
"Gave me a chance of walking round the country and seeing folk, and hearing the news, and knowing where the good beer was."
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Robin Smallburrow
text: Response: After you travel to a location, spend 1 [spirit] resource to raise the engagement cost of each enemy in play by X until the end of the round, where X is that location's quest points. Any player may trigger this response.

name: Interrogation
text: Action: Choose an enemy with an attached Trap card. Look at the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is that enemy's printed [threat]. You may discard 1 of those cards. Return the rest to the top of the deck, in the same order.

flavor:
"Strider can take you by paths that are seldom tridden. Will you have him?"
<cite>Aragorn, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Strider
text:
Attach to a hero.
While you control 2 or fewer heroes, attached hero does not exhaust to commit to the quest.
While you control 5 or fewer characters, attached hero gets +2 [willpower].

name: The Grotto
text:
Setup: Set the Shrine to Morgoth aside, out of play. Prepare the Grotto deck. Add the top 2 locations from the Grotto deck to the staging area, Grotto side faceup (the top 3 instead if there are 3 or 4 players in the game). The first player takes control of Captain Sahír, and the last player takes control of Na’asiyah (objective-ally sides faceup).

While an Underwater location is the active location, players cannot play attachments or allies.
Forced: After a double-sided location is explored, add the top location from the Grotto deck to the staging area, Grotto side faceup.
You cannot advance unless there are at least 3 Underwater locations in the victory display.

name: Sahír’s Betrayal
text:
When Revealed: Make the set aside Shrine to Morgoth the active location, Grotto side faceup. Captain Sahír flips to his enemy side (removing all tokens) and makes an immediate attack against the first player. Remove Captain Sahír from the game. Each player searches the encounter deck for an Undead enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

While an Underwater location is the active location, players cannot play attachments or allies.

name: Shrine to Morgoth
text:
Shrine to Morgoth cannot have attachments and cannot enter the staging area.
Forced: At the beginning of the quest phase, flip Shrine to Morgoth to its Underwater side, without removing its progress tokens.
When Shrine to Morgoth is placed in the victory display, the players have escaped from the flooded grotto and win the game.

name: Sea-scorpion
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead if the active location is Underwater).
text: Sea-scorpion gets +2 [Attack] if the active location is Underwater.

name: Cave Eel
text:
Cave Eel cannot be engaged unless the active location is Underwater.
Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, return Cave Eel to the staging area unless the active location is Underwater.

name: Undersea Grotto
text:
While Undersea Grotto is the active location, reduce the cost of the first ally played by the players each round by 1.
Response: After you travel to Undersea Grotto, you may flip it to its Underwater side.

name: Undersea Grotto
text:
While Undersea Grotto is the active location, reduce the cost of the first ally played by the players each round by 1.
Response: After you travel to Undersea Grotto, you may flip it to its Underwater side.

name: Undersea Grotto
text:
While Undersea Grotto is the active location, reduce the cost of the first ally played by the players each round by 1.
Response: After you travel to Undersea Grotto, you may flip it to its Underwater side.

name: Cursed Caverns
text:
Response: After you travel to Cursed Caverns, you may flip it to its Underwater side.
Response: After the players explore Cursed Caverns as the active location, each player may raise his threat by 2 to draw the bottom card of his deck.

name: Cursed Caverns
text:
Response: After you travel to Cursed Caverns, you may flip it to its Underwater side.
Response: After the players explore Cursed Caverns as the active location, each player may raise his threat by 2 to draw the bottom card of his deck.

name: Cursed Caverns
text:
Response: After you travel to Cursed Caverns, you may flip it to its Underwater side.
Response: After the players explore Cursed Caverns as the active location, each player may raise his threat by 2 to draw the bottom card of his deck.

name: Water-logged Halls
text:
While Water-logged Halls is the active location, each Undead enemy in play gets –1 [Threat].
Forced: After you travel to Water-logged Halls, you may flip it to its Underwater side.

name: Water-logged Halls
text:
While Water-logged Halls is the active location, each Undead enemy in play gets –1 [Threat].
Forced: After you travel to Water-logged Halls, you may flip it to its Underwater side.

name: Drowned Cave
text:
While Drowned Cave is the active location, Undead enemies cannot be engaged (return any engaged Undead enemies to the staging area).
Forced: If Drowned Cave is the active location at the end of the quest phase, each player must discard the top 10 cards of his deck. Then, you may return Drowned Cave to the staging area.

name: Powerful Undertow
text: When Revealed: You cannot flip the active location this round. If the active location is Underwater, resolve its Forced effect as if it is the end of the quest phase. If there is no Underwater active location, Powerful Undertow gains doomed 3, instead.

name: Into the Abyss
shadow_text: Shadow: If the active location is Underwater, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Creature enemy, and add it to the staging area.
text: When Revealed: Each player chooses a card type and discards each card in his hand that is not of the chosen card type. If no cards are discarded by this effect, Into the Abyss gains surge.

name: Tangling and Grasping
shadow_text: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.
text: When Revealed: Each player must remove a character from the quest. If the active location is Underwater, deal 2 damage to each character removed from the quest by this effect.

name: Ancient Depths
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack] (+2 [Attack] instead if the active location is Underwater).
text: When Revealed: Add the top location from the Grotto deck to the staging area and flip that location to its Underwater side. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Na'asiyah
text: Resources in Na'asiyah's resource pool cannot be used to pay for allies. Action: While Na'asiyah is attacking or defending, pay 1 resource from her resource pool to give her +2 [attack] or +2 [defense] for this attack.

name: Rune-master
text: Attach to a Ranger or [leadership] hero. Response: After a Signal attachment is attached to a hero, exhaust Rune-master to add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

flavor: So great a power and royalty was revealed in Aragorn...that many of the wild men paused, and looked back over their shoulders to the valley, and some looked up doubtfully at the sky. <cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Terrible to Behold
text: Response: After you declare a Noble character as a defender against an attack made by an engaged enemy, return that enemy to the staging area. Then, cancel the attack.

flavor:
The elves were the first to charge. Their hatred for the goblins is cold and bitter.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Veteran Sword-elf
text: Veteran Sword-elf gets +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] for each copy of Veteran Sword-elf in your discard pile.

name: Vigilant Guard
text: Attach to a Warrior character. Limit 1 per character. Attached character gets +2 hit points. Response: When another character would be assigned any amount of damage, place 1 of that damage on attached character instead.

flavor:
"Good!" said Legolas. "But my count is now two dozen. It has been knife-work up here."
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Knife-work
text: Action: Choose a player. Each enemy engaged with that player gets -1 [defense] until the end of the phase. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [lore] resources to have the chosen player draw 1 card each time he attacks and destroys an enemy this phase.

name: Linhir Sea-captain
text: Response: After you play Linhir Sea-captain from your hand, if you paid all of its resouce cost from a single hero's resource pool, both that hero and Linhir Sea-captain do not exhaust to quest this round.

flavor: ...the great grey steed Windfola made little of the burden; for Dernhelm was less in weight than many men, though lithe and well-knit in frame. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Windfola
text: Attach to a [spirit] hero, or to Éowyn. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [willpower]. Response: After attached character is removed from the quest, exhaust Windfola to commit attached hero to the quest.

flavor: Thus spake Ioreth, wise-woman of Gondor: The hands of the king are the hands of a healer, and so shall the rightful king be known. <cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Ioreth
text: Cannot attack or defend. Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource and exhaust Ioreth. Then, heal 3 points of damage on a character. Any player may trigger this action.

name: The Houses of Healing
text: You may exhaust any number of Healer characters you control as part of this card's cost. Reduce the cost to play this card by 1 for each Healer character you exhaust in this way. Refresh Action: Choose a hero in any player's discard pile. Put that hero into play under its owner's control, with 1 damage token on it.

flavor:
"...it is the last move in a great jeopardy, and for one side or the other it will bring the end of the game."
<cite>Aragorn, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Justice Shall Be Done
text: Limit 1 per deck. Planning Action: Add Justice Shall Be Done to the victory display to draw 3 cards and add 3 resources to the resource pool of each hero you control. At the end of the round, you are eliminated from the game.

name: Outmaneuver the Enemy
text:
Setup: Prepare the Corsair deck. Players prepare their fleet. Set each copy of Dol Amroth Warship aside, out of play. Search the encounter deck for Raider Flagship and 1 copy of Scouting Ship, and add them to the staging area. Search the encounter deck for a Dol Amroth objective of your choice and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck and resolve the Guarded keyword on that objective.

Sailing.
Forced: When a Ship enemy engages you, if you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔), deal 2 damage to a Ship objective you control. If you are on-course (󲂑), deal 2 damage to that Ship enemy instead.
If your current heading is at the worst setting (󲂔), Raider Flagship gets –50 engagement cost.

name: Battle in the Bay
text:
When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Ship enemy and add it to the staging area (2 Ship enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck. For each unguarded objective in the staging area, attach a non-unique Ship enemy in the staging area to that objective, guarding it.

Sailing.
If your current heading is at the worst setting (󲂔), Raider Flagship gets –50 engagement cost.
You cannot advance while at least 1 objective is guarded by an encounter.

name: Break Through the Fleet!
text:
When Revealed: The players make engagement checks against each enemy in the staging area. Raider Flagship gets –50 engagement cost during these engagement checks.

Sailing.
Raider Flagship gets –50 engagement cost.
Break Through the Fleet! has +5 quest points for each Ship enemy in play.
If this stage is defeated, or if Raider Flagship is in the victory display, the players have broken through the Corsair fleet and win the game!

name: Dol Amroth Warship
text:
Immune to player card effects.
If you are on-course (󲂑), Dol Amroth Warship gets +2 [Willpower], +2 [Attack], and +2 [Defense].
Forced: When Dol Amroth Warship is destroyed, set it aside, out of play.

name: Raider Flagship
text:
Boarding 1. Immune to player card effects.
Only Ship objectives can be declared as attackers against Raider Flagship.
Forced: At the beginning of the encounter phase, the engaged player reveals the top card of the Corsair deck and engages it.

name: Corsair Skirmisher
text:
Boarding 1. Immune to player card effects.
Response: After Corsair Skirmisher is destroyed as an enemy, the engaged player may discard allies he controls with a total of at least 3 [Willpower] to take control of Corsair Skirmisher as a Ship-Objective with [Willpower] equal to its [Threat]. (It loses the Ship-Enemy card type and gains the Ship-Objective card type).

name: Siege Ship
text:
Archery 2. Cannot have attachments.
While Siege Ship is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: At the end of the quest phase, if Siege Ship is not guarding an objective and there is an unguarded objective in the staging area, attach Siege Ship to that objective, guarding it.”

name: Heavy Cruiser
text:
Boarding 2. Cannot have attachments.
When Revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dol Amroth objective and add it to the staging area. Then, attach Heavy Cruiser to that objective, guarding it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
󲂐

name: Coast of Anfalas
shadow_text:
If you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔), attacking enemy gets +2 [Attack].
󲂐
text:
If you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔), Coast of Anfalas gets +2 [Threat].
Travel: Exhaust a Ship objective to travel here.

name: Belfalas Islet
text:
You cannot travel to Belfalas Islet if you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔).
Response: After you travel to Belfalas Islet, choose a Ship enemy that is not guarding an objective. While Belfalas Islet is the active location, the chosen enemy is considered to be out of play.

name: Cobas Haven
shadow_text: Shadow: If you are off-course, attacking enemy gets +2 [Attack].
text: While Cobas Haven is the active location, reduce the Boarding X value on each Ship enemy by 1.

name: Ramming Speed!
text:
When Revealed: If you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔), the engaged Ship enemy with the highest [Attack] makes an immediate attack. Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the total [Threat] in the staging area for each damage dealt by this attack. If no attack is made as a result of this effect, Ramming Speed! gains doomed 2.
󲂐

name: Taking on Water
shadow_text: Shadow: If defending character is a Ship, attach Taking on Water to it.
text: When Revealed: Attach to a Ship objective. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: “Forced: When attached objective exhausts, deal 2 damage to it. Action: Exhaust 3 characters you control to discard Taking on Water.”)

name: The Raiders’ Assault
text:
When Revealed: Choose a Ship enemy that is not currently guarding an objective. Attach that enemy to an unguarded objective in the staging area, guarding it (return that enemy to the staging area if it is engaged). If no Ship enemy is returned to the staging area by this effect, The Raiders’ Assault gains surge.
󲂐

name: Sea-ward Tower
text:
Guarded.
If Sea-ward Tower is free of encounters, add it to the staging area, controlled by the players.
While the players control Sea-ward Tower, look at 2 additional cards from the top of the encounter deck during each Sailing test.
󲂐

name: Tower of the Gull
text:
Guarded.
If Tower of the Gull is free of encounters, add it to the staging area, controlled by the players.
Combat Action: If the players control Tower of the Gull, exhaust it to deal 2 damage to a non-unique Ship enemy. Any player may trigger this action.
󲂐

name: The Beacon
text:
Guarded.
If The Beacon is free of encounters, add it to the staging area, controlled by the players.
Planning Action: If the players control The Beacon, exhaust it and spend 5 resources to take control of 1 set aside copy of Dol Amroth Warship. Any player may trigger this action.
󲂐

name: Tower of the Heron
text:
Guarded.
If Tower of the Heron is free of encounters, add it to the staging area, controlled by the players.
While Tower of the Heron is controlled by the players, reduce the archery total by 4.
󲂐

name: Prince Imrahil
text: Combat Action: Spend 1 resource from Prince Imrahil's resource pool to search the top 5 cards of your deck for an ally who shares at least 1 Trait with him, and put that ally into play. Shuffle your deck. At the end of the phase, if that ally is still in play, shuffle it into your deck. (Limit once per round.)

flavor:
"...to be only a man of arms of the Guard of the Tower of Gondor is held worthy in the City, and such men have honour in the land." 
<cite>Beregond, The Return of the King</cite>
name: Knight of the White Tower
text: Knight of the White Tower's resource cost must be paid from a single hero’s resource pool.

name: Hold the Line
text: Response: When an enemy attacks a player, that player may declare up to 3 eligible characters as defenders against this attack. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [tactics] resources to ready each defending character that takes no damage from this attack.

flavor:
...he and his knights still held themselves like lords in whom the race of Númenor ran true.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Soldier of Dol Amroth
text: Response: After Soldier of Dol Amroth enters play, reduce the cost of the next [tactics] card you play this phase by 1.

name: Súlien
text: Action: Spend 1 [lore] resource to exhaust Súlien. Then, each location in the staging area gets –1 [threat] until the end of the phase. Any player may trigger this action.

flavor:
Wherever he came men's hearts would lift again, and the winged shadows pass from memory.
<cite>The Return of the King</cite>
name: Inspiring Presence
text: Action: Choose a hero you control. Each hero with lower threat cost than the chosen hero gets +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. Then, the players as a group may spend 2 [leadership] resources to give +2 [attack] to each hero with lower threat cost than the chosen hero until the end of the phase.

flavor:
From such men the Lord Denethor chose his forayers…to harry the Orcs and other enemies that roamed between the Ephel Dúath and the River.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Guardian of Ithilien
text: Response: After Guardian of Ithilien enters play, return an enemy engaged with you to the staging area.

flavor:
Two had spears in their hands with broad bright heads.
<cite>The Two Towers</cite>
name: Ranger Spear
text: Attach to a Ranger character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead when attacking an enemy with an attachment on it).

name: Prince of Dol Amroth
text: Attach to Prince Imrahil. Price Imrahil gains the Outlands trait. While you control Outlands allies that belong to 4 different spheres, add 1 additional resource to Prince Imrahil's resource pool when you collect resources during the resource phase (if Prince Imrahil is a hero).

name: The Coast of Umbar
text:
Setup: Shuffle the Coast of Umbar, Corsair Raiders, Stormy Weather, Umbar Fleet, and Voyage Across Belegaer encounter sets into one encounter deck and make it the active encounter deck. Set The City of Corsairs encounter set aside, as an inactive second encounter deck. Prepare the Corsair deck. Players prepare their fleet. Add the Stormcaller to the staging area. Add 1 copy of Southern Belfalas to the staging area (2 instead if there are 3 or 4 players in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck.

Sailing.
Progress cannot be placed on The Coast of Umbar if the players are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔).
If the Stormcaller is destroyed (or if this stage has 15 or more progress on it), advance to stage 2.

name: Fate of The Dream-chaser
text:
When Revealed: Each player assigns damage among non-Ship characters he controls equal to the total damage on each Ship objective he controls. Discard all Ship enemies, Ship objectives, and Ocean locations in play.

When Revealed: Shuffle the Corsair deck and Corsair discard pile into the second encounter deck. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for each copy of Battle-hardened and each copy of Watch Tower, and shuffle them into the second encounter deck. Set the current encounter deck and discard pile aside, inactive. The second encounter deck becomes the active encounter deck. Advance to stage 3.

name: The Haven of Umbar
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for The Shattered Monument and Captain Sahír, and set them aside, out of play. Each player searches the encounter deck for 1 enemy and 1 location, and adds them to the staging area. If the Stormcaller was not destroyed during stage 1, add 1 resource to each Raider enemy in play.

name: Final Confrontation
text:
When Revealed: Add The Shattered Monument to the staging area. Put Captain Sahír into play, engaged with the first player. Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and adds it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck. Add 1 resource to each Raider enemy in play.

While another enemy has resources on it, Captain Sahír gains indestructible.
Forced: When a hero or enemy is destroyed, add its resources to Captain Sahír.
If Captain Sahír is destroyed, the players have finally put an end to the Corsairs’ treacherous plot and win the game.

name: Stormcaller
text:
Boarding 1. Cannot have attachments.
Forced: At the end of the round, if the Stormcaller is engaged with a player, either return it to the staging area or shift your heading off-course.

name: Slave Ship
text:
Boarding 1. Cannot have attachments.
For each point of damage that is dealt to a Ship objective by Slave Ship’s attack, deal 1 point of damage to a non-Ship character controlled by the defending player, as well.

name: Umbar Slaver
text:
Umbar Slaver gets +1 [Attack] and +1 [Threat] for each resource on it.
Forced: After the engaged player spends any number of resources, place 1 of those resources on Umbar Slaver.

name: Southern Belfalas
shadow_text:
Shadow: If this attack destroys a character, discard an ally controlled by the defending player.
󲂐
text: Travel: One player must reveal the top card of the Corsair deck and engage it to travel here.

name: Corsair Waters
shadow_text:
Shadow: Either shift your heading off-course, or treat this attack as undefended.
󲂐
text: While Corsair Waters is the active location, no more than 1 ally can enter play each round.

name: Watch Tower
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack destroys a ally, add resources to a Raider enemy in play equal to that character’s printed resource cost.
text: While Watch Tower is in the staging area, it gains: “Forced: When a Raider enemy enters play, add 1 resource to it.”

name: Serpent’s Tail
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 shadow card to each Ship enemy in play. Then, if you are off-course (󲂒, 󲂓, or 󲂔), each Ship enemy in play gets –10 engagement cost until the end of the round.

name: Captain Sahír
text:
Captain Sahír engages the first player.
For each point of damage Captain Sahír would take, discard 1 resource from him and cancel that damage.
For every 5 resources on Captain Sahír, he makes an additional attack against the engaged player each combat phase.

name: The Shattered Monument
text:
Each Raider enemy with at least 1 resource on it is immune to player events.
Forced: At the beginning of the resource phase, add 1 resource to each Raider enemy in play.

name: City of Corsairs
text:
X is the highest number of resources on a Raider enemy in play.
Travel: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Corsair enemy and add it to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Streets of Umbar
shadow_text: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Raider, deal it an additional shadow card for each resource token on it, to a maximum of 3 additional shadow cards.
text: When faced with the option to travel, if Streets of Umbar is in the staging area, the players must either travel to a location named Streets of Umbar or add 2 resources to a Raider enemy in play.

name: Umbar Harbor
shadow_text: Shadow: If attacking enemy is a Raider, move 1 resource from a hero you control to attacking enemy.
text: While Umbar Harbor is the active location, Corsair enemies get +2 [Defense].

name: Foes of Ecthelion
text: When Revealed: Add 2 resources to a Raider enemy in the staging area. Each Raider enemy in the staging area gets +1 [Threat] for each resource on it until the end of the phase. If there are no Raider enemies in the staging area, Foes of Ecthelion gains surge.

name: Umbar Patrol
text: When Revealed: Each player returns an enemy engaged with him to the staging area. Until the end of the round, enemies cannot be optionally engaged. If there are no enemies in the staging area, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy and add it to the staging area.

name: Fury and Malice
text: When Revealed: Add 1 resource to each engaged Raider enemy. Then, each player assigns damage among characters he controls equal to the number of resource tokens on Raider enemies engaged with him. If no damage is assigned by this effect, Fury and Malice gains surge.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo Baggins cannot gain resources from player card effects. If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players lose the game.

flavor: "I am Thorin son of Thrain son of Thror, King under the Mountain!" <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thorin Oakenshield
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, add 1 additional resource to Thorin Oakenshield's pool when you collect resources during the resource phase.

flavor: "Nori, at your service." <cite>Nori, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Nori
text: Response: After you play a Dwarf character from your hand, reduce your threat by 1.

flavor: "He could write well and speedily, and often used the Elvish characters." <cite>Gimli, The Fellowship of the Ring</cite>
name: Ori
text: If you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, draw 1 additional card at the beginning of the resource phase.

flavor:
The roar of his voice was like drums and guns; and he tossed wolves and goblins from his path like straws and feathers.
<cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Beorn
text:
Sentinel. Cannot have attachments.
Immune to player card effects.
Beorn does not exhaust to defend.

flavor: "Fili is the youngest and still has the best sight." - Thorin, The Hobbit
name: Fili
text: Response: After you play Fili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Kili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

flavor: "Let us join the throng!" - Kili, The Hobbit
name: Kili
text: Response: After you play Kili from your hand during the planning phase, search your deck for Fili and put him into play under your control. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Bofur
text: Action: Exhaust Bofur to search the top 5 cards of your deck for 1 Weapon attachment. Add that card to your hand and shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Dori
text: Response: After a hero is assigned any amount of damage, exhaust Dori to place that damage on Dori instead.

name: Gandalf
text: Gandalf does not exhaust to commit to a quest. Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, discard Gandalf from play. You may raise your threat by 2 to cancel this effect.

name: Cram
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Discard Cram to ready attached hero.

flavor: "You will have to manage without pocket-handkerchiefs, and a good many other things, before you get to the journey's end. As for a hat, I have got a spare hood and cloak in my luggage." <cite>Dwalin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Spare Hood and Cloak
text: Attach to a character. Action: Exhaust Spare Hood and Cloak and exhaust attached character to ready another character. Then, attach Spare Hood and Cloak to that character.

flavor: "This was made by Thror, your grandfather, Thorin." he said in answer to the dwarves' excited questions. "It is a plan of the Mountain." <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thror's Map
text: Attach to a hero. Travel Action: Exhaust Thror's Map to choose a location in the staging area. Make that location the active location. (If there is another active location, return it to the staging area.)

name: A Very Good Tale
text: Action: Exhaust 2 allies you control to shuffle your deck and discard the top 5 cards. Put up to 2 allies discarded by this effect into play under your control. The total cost of the allies put into play cannot exceed the total cost of the allies exhausted to pay for this effect.

name: Foe-hammer
text: Response: After a hero you control attacks and destroys an enemy, exhaust a Weapon card attached to that hero to draw 3 cards.

flavor: At this point Gandalf fell behind, and Thorin with him. They turned a sharp corner. "About turn!" he shouted. "Draw your sword, Thorin!" <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Goblin-cleaver
text: Combat Action: Exhaust a Weapon card attached to a hero you control to choose an enemy engaged with you. Deal 2 damage to that enemy. (Deal 3 damage instead if the enemy is an Orc.)

flavor: To the end of his days Bilbo could never remember how he found himself outside, without a hat, walking-stick or any money, or anything that he usually took when he went out. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Late Adventurer
text: Quest Action: Exhaust a character you control that is not committed to the quest to commit that character to the quest.

name: Expecting Mischief
text: Play during the quest phase, before the staging step. Action: Deal 2 damage to the first enemy revealed from the encounter deck this phase.

flavor: "You can say Expert Treasure-hunter instead of Burglar if you like. Some of them do." - Gloin, The Hobbit
name: Burglar Baggins
text: Action: Bilbo Baggins gets +2 [willpower] +2 [attack] and +2 [defense] until the end of the phase. (You may spend a [baggins] resource from Bilbo Baggins' resource pool to play this card even if you do not control Bilbo Baggins.)

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor: "I shall call you Sting." <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Sting
text: Restricted. Attach to Bilbo Baggins. Bilbo Baggins gets +1 [willpower] +1 [attack] and +1 [defense]. Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend, discard the top card of the encounter deck. Deal damage to the attacking enemy equal to the discarded card's [threat].

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor: "This, Thorin, the runes name Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver in the ancient tongue of Gondolin; it was a famous blade." <cite>Elrond, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Orcrist
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero destroys an Orc enemy, add 1 resource to that hero's resource pool.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor: "This, Gandalf, was Glamdring, Foe-hammer that the king of Gondolin once wore." - Elrond, The Hobbit
name: Glamdring
text: Attach to a hero or Gandalf. Restricted. Attached character gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached character destroys an Orc enemy, draw 1 card.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor:
The wizard Gandalf has chosen Bilbo Baggins to join Thorin and company on their quest to the Lonley Mountain.
At first they had passed through hobbit-lands, a wild respectable country inhabited by decent folk, with good roads, an inn or two, and now and then, a dwarf or a farmer ambling by on business. Then they came to lands where people spoke strangely, and sang songs Bilbo had never heard before. - The Hobbit.
name: An Unexpected Party
text: Setup: Remove and shuffle the 7 Sack cards into a Sack deck and set it aside face down. Remove the 3 Troll enemies and the Troll Cave from the encounter deck and set them aside out of play. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. Each player reveals 1 card from the top of the encounter deck and adds it to the staging area.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor: Obviously trolls. Even Bilbo, in spite of his sheltered life, could see that: from the great heavy faces of them, and their size, and the shape of their legs, not to mention their language, which was not drawing-room fashion at all - The Hobbit
name: Roast Mutton
text:
When Revealed: Add the set-aside Troll enemies and the Troll Cave to the staging area. Shuffle the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.
Forced: If there are no Troll enemies left in play, or if there are no cards left in the encounter deck, advance it to the next stage.
Any time players would place progress tokens on this quest, discard an equal number of cards from the encounter deck instead. (Progress is placed on the active location before triggering this effect.)

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
flavor: "Dawn take you all, and be stone to you!" said a voice that sounded like William's but it wasn't. For just at that moment the light came over the hill, and there was a mighty twitter in the branches. William never spoke for he stood turned to stone as he stooped; and Bert and Tom were stuck like rocks as they looked at him. - The Hobbit
name: Dawn Take You All
text:
When Revealed: Remove all Troll enemies and Sack cards from the game. If Troll Cave is in the victory display, the players have discovered the treasure cards Sting, Glamdring, and Orcrist.
The players have won the game

flavor: After a refreshing stay in the House of Elrond, Bilbo and his companions resumed their quest for the Lonely Mountain. But to reach Erebor, they first had to climb the high pass over the Misty Mountains.
name: A Short Rest
text:
Setup: Shuffle the Over the Misty Mountains Grim and Western Lands encounter sets into one encounter deck and make it the active encounter deck. Then, shuffle the The Great Goblin and Misty Mountain Goblins encounter sets into a second encounter deck and set it aside, inactive.

When Revealed: Each player may search his deck for 1 treasure card and add it to his hand, then shuffle his deck. Advance to stage 2A.

flavor: When he peeped out in the lightning-flashes, he saw that across the valley the stone-giants were out and were hurling rocks at one another for a game, and catching them, and tossing them down into the darkness where they smashed the trees far below, or splintered into little bits with a bang. - The Hobbit
name: The Mountain Pass
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for 1 copy of Stone-giant and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal 1 card per player from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

flavor: Out jumped the goblins, big goblins, great ugly-looking goblins, lots of goblins, before you could say rocks and blocks. - The Hobbit
name: Down, Down to Goblin Town
text:
When Revealed: Shuffle all encounter cards back into the encounter deck and set it aside, inactive. The second encounter deck becomes the active encounter deck. Search the encounter deck for The Great Goblin and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.
Players cannot defeat this stage unless The Great Goblin is in the victory display.
When Revealed: Reveal 3 encounter cards per player, Bilbo Baggins may spend X resources to reduce the total number of encounter cards revealed by X. (To a minimum of 1.)
If the players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

flavor: After killing the Great Goblin, Bilbo's companions fought to win their escape from the goblins. By the time they realized that Bilbo had been lost in the darkness, it was too late to turn back and search for him.
name: Out of the Frying Pan
text:
Setup: Add Lake in the Cavern to the staging area. Create a riddle area with stage 2A and follow the setup instructions on that card.
Players cannot advance to stage 3A unless both 1B and 2B are complete.
Forced: Reveal 1 additional encounter card per player during the staging step.

flavor: During the confusion, bilbo stumbled won a tunnel and into Gollum's cave. There the Hobbit had to outwit the creature Gollum in a dangerous riddle contest to discover the way out.
name: Riddles in the Dark
text:
Setup: Search the encounter deck for Gollum and Bilbo's Magic Ring. Place Gollum and Bilbo Baggins in the riddle area and attach Bilbo's Magic Ring to Bilbo Baggins. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.
Players cannot advance to stage 3A unless both 1B and 2B are complete.
Progress tokens cannot be added to, or removed from, this quest except by answering riddles.
Cards in the riddle area are immune to player card effects and cannot leave the riddle area except by quest effects.

flavor: To everyone's surprise, Bilbo Baggins rejoined his companions on the eastern side of the Misty Mountains. However, their celebration was cut short by the chilling sound of wolves howling close by. To the frightened hobbit, it seemed that they had escaped from the goblins only to be eaten by wargs.
name: Into the Fire
text:
When Revealed: The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Reveal 1 encounter card per player and add it to the staging area.
Gollum engages the first player. Damage from undefended attacks made by Gollum must be placed on Bilbo Baggins.
All riddle effects are ignored. Treachery cards gain surge.
If players defeat this stage, they have won the game.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: William
text:
Troll enemies not engaged with a player cannot take damage.
Forced: After William engages a player, sack 2.
Forced: Return William to the staging area at the end of the combat phase. The engaged player may raise his threat by 1 to cancel this effect.

Victory 5.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Bert
text:
Players cannot play attachment cards on Troll enemies.
Forced: After Bert engages a player, sack 1.
Forced: Return Bert to the staging area at the end of the combat phase. The engaged player may raise his threat by 1 to cancel this effect

Victory 3

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Tom
text:
Troll enemies can only be attacked by one character at a time.
Forced: After Tom engages a player, sack 1.
Forced: Return Tom to the staging area at the end of the combat phase. The engaged player may raise his threat by 1 to cancel this effect.

Victory 4.

name: A Suspicious Crow
shadow_text: Shadow: If this attack deals at least 1 damage, shuffle this card back into the encounter deck.
text: When Revealed: Reveal the top card of the encounter discard pile and add it to the staging area, if able.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Camp
text:
While Troll Camp is in the staging area, Troll enemies get +1 [Threat] for each player in the game.
While Troll Camp is in play, Bilbo Baggins gains: "Action: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins and spend 1 [Baggins] resource to remove 1 sack card from a character. Bilbo Baggins may trigger this effect even with a Sack card attached to him."

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Cave
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Players cannot travel to Troll Cave unless Bilbo Baggins has the Troll Key attached and the first player spends 5 [Baggins] resources. (2 [Baggins] resources instead if Bilbo Baggins has the Troll Purse attached.)
Victory 2.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Hobbit-lands
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player must put the top card of the encounter deck discard pile on top of the encounter deck.
text: Response: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Hobbit-lands, the first player draws 1 card.

name: Dreary Hills
text:
Forced: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Dreary Hills, each player must discard 1 card at random from his hand.
Response: After Dreary Hills leaves play as an explored location, Bilbo Baggins gains 1 resource.

name: Lone-Lands
text:
Forced: After placing 1 or more progress tokens on Lone-Lands, each player removes 1 resource token from one of his hero's resource pools, if able.
Response: After Lone-Lands leaves play as an explored location, Bilbo Baggins gains 1 resource.

flavor: That, of course, is the dangerous part about caves: you don't know how far they go back. - The Hobbit
name: Cave Entrance
text: While Cave Entrance is in the staging area, it gains "Forced: At the end of the round, place the top X cards of the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck. X is the number of players in the game."

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Purse
text:
If Troll Purse is discarded, resolve its "When Revealed" effect, if able.
When Revealed: Attach to a Troll enemy.
Response: After attached Troll enemy is destroyed, the first player may spend 1 [Baggins] resource to claim this objective and attach it to Bilbo Baggins.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Troll Key
text:
If Troll Key is discarded, resolve its "When Revealed" effect if able.
When Revealed: Attach to a Troll enemy.
Response: After attached Troll enemy takes damage as the result of an attack, the first player may exhaust Bilbo Baggins to claim this objective and attach it to him.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Smelly Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the ally (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed cost without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Strong Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Attack] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Tough Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Defense] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Large Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed hit points without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Deep Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the highest printed [Willpower] without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Foul Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to the character (excluding Gandalf) with the most attachments without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Worn Sack
text:
When Sacked: Attach to hero with the most resources without a Sack attached.
Attached character cannot ready, attack, defend, commit to quests, or trigger effects. If this Sack card is removed, shuffle it into the sack deck.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Lots or None at All
shadow_text: Shadow: If the attacking enemy is a Troll, Sack 1. (The first player may spend 1 [Baggins] resource to cancel this effect.)
text: When Revealed: If there is a Troll enemy in the staging area, Sack 1. If there are no Troll enemies in the staging area, this card gains Doomed 2.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: A Nice Pickle
shadow_text: Shadow: Shuffle this card into the encounter deck.
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Place the top X cards of the encounter discard pile on the bottom of the encounter deck. X is equal to twice the number of players in the game.

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Roast 'Em or Boil 'Em?
shadow_text: Shadow: Search the encounter deck for Troll Camp and add it to the staging area. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.
text: When Revealed: Deal 1 damage to each ally. (2 damage instead if there is a Troll enemy in the staging area.)

encounter_name: We Must Away, Ere Break of Day
name: Hungry Troll
shadow_text: Shadow: Deal 4 damage to each character with a Sack card attached. (The first player may spend 2 [Baggins] resources to cancel this effect.)
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a Troll enemy in the staging area and engages that enemy. If there are no Troll enemies in the staging area, this card gains Surge.

name: No Campfire
shadow_text: Shadow: The defending player raises his threat by 2.
text:
Doomed 1.
When Revealed: Each player must choose one: increase his threat by 4, or reveal an additional encounter card from the encounter deck and add it to the staging area.

flavor: "I'm sure the rain has got into the dry clothes and into the food-bags." - Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit
name: Wind-whipped Rain
shadow_text: Shadow: The defending character gets -1 [Defense]
text: When Revealed: Discard all non-treasure, non-objective attachments in play.

flavor: "As soon as I clapped eyes on the little fellow bobbing and puffing on the mat, I had my doubts. He looks more like a grocer than a burglar!" - Gloin The Hobbit
name: More Like A Grocer
shadow_text: Shadow: Resolve this card's "When Revealed" effect.
text: When Revealed: Discard all [Baggins] resources.

name: Goblin Axeman
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending character gets -1 [Defense].
text: Goblin Axeman gets +1 [Attack] for each Cave location in play.

name: Goblin Miners
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack].
text: Goblin Miners gets +1 [Defense] for each Cave location in play.

name: Goblin Runners
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy makes an additional attack immediately after this one. (Deal a new shadow card for that attack.)
text: Surge.

name: Goblin Driver
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player exhausts 1 character he controls.
text: When Revealed: The first player exhausts 1 character he controls.

name: Goblin Bent-Swords
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. (+2 [Attack] instead if The Great Goblin is in the victory display.)
text: If The Great Goblin is in the victory display, this card gains surge.

name: The Great Goblin
text:
Forced: After The Great Goblin attacks, discard X cards from the encounter deck where X is the number of players in the game. Add each Goblin enemy discarded by this effect to the staging area.

Victory 3.

name: Stone-Giant
text:
While at least one Stone-Giant is in the staging area, the Galloping Boulders card gains surge.
Forced: After Stone-Giant engages a player, that player chooses and discards 1 ally he controls.

name: The Goblins' Caves
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player raises his threat by X. X is the number of Goblin enemies engaged with him.
text: While The Goblins' Caves is the active location, Goblin enemies get +1 [Threat].

name: Front Porch
text:
While Front Porch is the active location, players cannot attack Goblin enemies.
Action: The first player may spend 2 [Baggins] resources to treat Front Porch's printed text box as if it were blank until the end of the round.

name: Great Cavern Room
text:
While Great Cavern Room is the active location, it gains: "Forced: After a player engages a Goblin enemy, he must deal 1 damage to a character he controls."
Forced: When faced with the option to travel, if The Great Goblin is in the victory display the players must travel to Great Cavern Room if able.

flavor: "This won't do at all!" said Thorin. "If we don't get blown off or drowned, or struck by lightning, we shall be picked up by some giant and kicked sky-high for a football." - Thorin Oakenshield, The Hobbit
name: Overhanging Rock
text: While Overhanging Rock is the active location, it gains: "Action: spend 1 [Baggins] resource to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 of those to your hand and discard the other."

flavor: There were many paths that led up into those mountains, and many passes over them. But most of the paths were cheats and deceptions and led nowhere or to bad ends. - The Hobbit
name: The High Pass
text:
X is the number of players in the game.
Forced: At the end of the round, remove X progress tokens from the current quest.

name: Grip, grab! Pinch, nab!
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending player deals damage among characters he controls equal to the number of Goblin enemies engaged with him.
text: When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player must choose 1 Goblin enemy from the discard pile and add it to the staging area.

name: Chaos in the Cavern
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy is returned to the staging area after its attack resolves.
text: When Revealed: All engaged enemies return to the staging area. Then, each Goblin enemy gets +1 [Threat] until the end of the phase.

name: Galloping Boulders
shadow_text: Shadow: Put this card on top of the encounter deck.
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses a questing character. That character takes 3 damage and is removed from the quest.

name: Guffawing of Giants
text: When Revealed: The first player chooses 1 Stone-giant in the staging area. At the end of the quest phase, that Stone-giant engages the player with the highest threat. If there are no Stone-giant cards in the staging area, search the encounter deck for 1 Stone-giant and add it to the staging area.

flavor: "If precious asks, and it doesn't answer, we eats it, my precious." - Gollum, The Hobbit
name: Gollum
text: Forced: After the first player answers a riddle and fails to find at least 1 match, Gollum attacks Bilbo Baggins. (Do not deal a shadow card for this attack.)

name: Great Gray Wolf
text:
Forced: If Great Grey wolf is dealt a shadow card with a riddle, return all Creature enemies to the staging area at the end of the combat phase.

Riddle: The first player names a card type, sphere and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches all three items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Wild Wargs
text:
Forced: If Wild Wargs is dealt a shadow card with a riddle, it gets +2 [Attack].
Riddle: The first player names a card type, shuffles his deck, and discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: The Wargs' Glade
text:
Forced: After a character takes damage from an attack made by a Creature enemy, remove 1 progress token from the current quest.
Riddle: The first player names a sphere, shuffles his deck, and discards the top card. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

flavor: Deep down here by the dark water lived old Gollum, a small slimy creature. - The Hobbit
name: Lake in the Cavern
text:
X is twice the number of players in the game.
Players cannot travel here.
Immune to player card effects.
Forced: After players advance to stage 3, remove Lake in the Cavern from the game.

name: Bilbo's Magic Ring
text:
Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Action: When answering a riddle, spend 1 [Baggins] resource to discard an additional player card from the top of your deck.
Action: Exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise each player's threat by 2 to add 1 [Baggins] resource to Bilbo Baggins' resource pool.

name: Come down little bird
text:
When Revealed: Starting with the first player, each player must search the encounter deck and encounter discard pile for 1 Creature enemy and put it into play engaged with him. Then, shuffle the encounter deck.
Riddle: The first player names a card type and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: It Likes Riddles
text:
When Revealed: The first player must choose to answer the riddle on this card. If he finds at least 1 match, discard cards from the encounter deck until another card with a riddle is discarded. Then, answer that riddle.
Riddle: The first player names a cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Hiding in the Trees
text:
When Revealed: Characters get -1 [Willpower] and cannot attack until the end of the round.
Riddle: The first player names a card type and sphere, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 3 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: What's In My Pocket
text:
When Revealed: The first player must choose to answer the riddle on this card. This effect cannot be canceled.
Riddle: The first player names a sphere and cost, shuffles his deck, then discards the top 2 cards. For each of those cards that matches both items, place 1 progress token on stage 2.

name: Not Fair! Not Fair!
text: When Revealed: The first player names a card type and then discards the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. For each of those cards that does not match the named type, remove 1 progress token from stage 2. This effect cannot be canceled.

name: Bilbo Baggins
text: Bilbo Baggins does not count against the hero limit and cannot gain resources from non-treasure cards. The first player gains control of Bilbo Baggins. Action: Spend 1 [baggins] resource to search your deck for a treasure card and add it to your hand. If Bilbo Baggins leaves play, the players have lost the game.

flavor: "Well, it is the first time that even a mouse has crept along carefully and quietly under my very nose and not been spotted." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Balin
text: Response: Pay 1 resource from Balin's resource pool to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an attack. Then, deal the attacking enemy another shadow card. (Limit once per attack.)

flavor: Now he shot with a great yew bow, till all his arrows but one were spent. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bard the Bowman
text:
Ranged.
When Bard the Bowman makes a ranged attack, the enemy he attacks gets -2 [defense] until the end of the phase.

flavor: Dwarves can make fire almost anywhere out of almost anything, wind or no wind... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Óin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Óin gets +1 [attack] and gains the [tactics] resource icon.

flavor: "Bombur is fattest and will do for two, he had better come alone and last." <cite>Gandalf, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bombur
text: When counting the number of Dwarf characters you control, Bombur counts as two.

flavor: Glóin lit several more torches, and then they all crept out, one by one... <cite> The Hobbit </cite>
name: Glóin
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Glóin gains: "Response: After you play Glóin from your hand, choose a hero. Add 2 resources to that hero's resource pool."

flavor: "My cousins! Bombur and Bofur <cite> we have forgotten them, they are down in the valley!" –The Hobbit</cite>
name: Bifur
text: While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, Bifur gains: "Response: After you play Bifur from your hand, draw 2 cards."

name: Dwalin
text: Sentinel. While you control at least 5 Dwarf characters, lower the cost to play Dwalin by 2.

flavor: In it smote and vanished, barb, shaft and feather, so fierce was its flight. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Straight Shot
text: Action: Exhaust a Weapon attachment to choose a non-unique enemy with 0 [defense]. Discard the chosen enemy.

flavor: "Come!" called Gandalf. "There is yet time for council." <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Desperate Alliance
text: Action: Choose a hero you control. Until the end of the phase, give control of that hero and all resources in that hero's resource pool to another player. (Limit 1 per phase.)

flavor: As they worked the ravens brought them constant tidings. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Ravens of the Mountain
text: Action: Exhaust a hero you control to shuffle the encounter deck and look at its top card. Place progress tokens on the current quest equal to the revealed card's [threat]. Then, put that card back on top of the encounter deck.

flavor: Out leapt the King under the Mountain, and his companions followed him. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: To me! O my kinsfolk!
text: Action: If you control at least 1 Dwarf hero, put a Dwarf ally from your discard pile into play under your control. Put that ally on the bottom of your deck at the end of the phase.

flavor:
"I am the clue-finder, the web-cutter, the stinging fly. I was chosen for the lucky number."
<cite>Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Lucky Number
text: Action: Choose a character in play (other than Bilbo Baggins). Add Bilbo Baggins' total [willpower], [attack], and [defense] to that character's [willpower], [attack], and [defense] respectively until the end of the phase.

name: Great Yew Bow
text: Attach to a hero with the printed Ranged keyword. Restricted. Combat Action: Choose an enemy in the staging area. Exhaust Great Yew Bow and attached hero to make a ranged attack against that enemy. Declare attached hero as the attacker. No other attackers can be declared for this attack.

flavor: "I have saved you to the last..." <cite>Bard, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Black Arrow
text: Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero with Ranged. Response: After attached hero declares an attack, add Black Arrow to the victory display to give attached hero +5 [attack] for this attack.

flavor: "The key that went with the map! Try it now while there is still time!" <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Key
text: Attach to a hero. Response: After a location is added to the staging area, attach Thrór's Key to that location. While attached to a location, Thrór's Key gains: "Treat attached location's printed text box as blank, except for traits."

flavor: "Now I am a burglar indeed!" - Bilbo, The Hobbit
name: Expert Treasure-hunter
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero quests successfully, name a card type and discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card is the named type, take it into your hand.

flavor: "Long ago in my grandfather Thror's time our family was driven out of the far North, and came back with all their wealth and tools to this Mountain on the map." <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: King Under the Mountain
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Action: Exhaust King Under the Mountain to look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Add 1 to your hand and discard the other.

name: Bilbo's Magic Ring
text: Attach to Bilbo Baggins. Action: Exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise your threat by 1 to gain 1 [baggins] resource. (Limit once per round.) Response: After Bilbo Baggins exhausts to defend an attack, exhaust Bilbo's Magic Ring and raise your threat by 3 to cancel all damage from this attack.

flavor: "...the Heart of the Mountain; and it is also the heart of Thorin. He values it above a rive of gold." <cite>Bilbo, The Hobbit</cite>
name: The Arkenstone
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Exhaust The Arkenstone and raise your threat by X to lower by X the cost of the next ally you play this phase that matches the attached hero's sphere.

flavor: "Mr. Baggins!" he cried. "Here is the first payment of your reward! Cast off your old coat and put on this!" <cite>Thorin, The Hobbit</cite>
name: Mithril Shirt
text:
Attach to Bilbo Baggins.
Attached hero gets +1 [defense] and +1 hit point.

flavor: Royal indeed did Thorin look, clad in a coat of gold-plated rings, with a silver hafted axe... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Battle Axe
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Attached hero gets +2 [attack]. Response: After attached hero attacks and destroys an enemy, deal 1 damage to another enemy engaged with you.

flavor: Thorin seized a bow of horn and shot an arrow at the speaker. <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Hunting Bow
text:
Attach to a hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gains Ranged.
When making a ranged attack, attached hero gets +2 [attack].

flavor: ...the great golden cup of Thror, two-handed, hammered and carven with birds and flowers whose eyes and petals were of jewels... <cite>The Hobbit</cite>
name: Thrór's Golden Cup
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Add Thror's Golden Cup to the victory display to draw 3 cards.

name: The Spider's Glade
text:
Immune to player card effects.
Travel: Exhaust Bilbo Baggins to travel here.
Forced: At the start of each quest phase, search the encounter deck for 1 Spider enemy and add it to the staging area. (2 Spider enemies instead if 3 or more players are at this stage.) Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Giant Web
text:
While Giant Web is the active location, each character gets -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense] for each poison it has.
Response: After Giant Web leaves play as an explored location, ready an unconscious character.

flavor: It flowed fast and strong but not very wide right across the way, and it was black, or looked it in the gloom. - The Hobbit
name: Forest Stream
text:
While Forest Stream is the active location, poisoned characters cannot quest.
Response: After Forest Stream leaves play as an explored location, discard 4 poison.

flavor: ...hairy legs waving, nippers an dspinners snapping, eyes popping, full of froth and rage. - The Hobbit
name: Old Tomnoddy
text:
Venom.
Forced: At the end of each round, each player must give a hero he controls 1 poison.

name: Crazy Cob
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending character gets 1 poison.
text:
Venom.
When Revealed: This enemy attacks the character with the most poison attached.

name: Lazy Lob
shadow_text: Shadow: If defending character is poisoned, make that character unconscious.
text:
Venom.
When Revealed: Each character committed to the quest gets 1 poison.

name: Fat Spider
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending character gets 1 poison. (Give 2 poison to a character you control if undefended.)
text:
Venom.
This enemy gets +3 [Attack] while engaged with a player who controls at least 1 poisoned character.

name: Wicked Spider
shadow_text: Shadow: Defending character gets 2 poison.
text:
Venom.
Forced: When this enemy attacks, defending player must attack 1 poison to a character he controls.

flavor: "What nasty thick skins they have to be sure, but I'll wager there is good juice inside." - Spider, The Hobbit
name: Caught in Webs
text: When Revealed: Choose a hero to be removed from the quest and make that hero unconscious. If no hero was removed from the quest by this effect, this card gains surge.

name: Poisoned by Spiders
shadow_text: Shadow: Discard an unconscious character you control.
text: When Revealed: Each character takes damage equal to the number of poison it has. If no characters were damaged by this effect, this card gains surge.

flavor: About midday, creeping behind a great stone that stood alone like a pillar, Bilbo came on what looked like rough steps going upwards. - The Hobbit
name: Hidden Path
text:
While Hidden Path is the active location, locations in the staging area get -1 [Threat].
Travel: Spend 2 [Baggins] resources to travel here.

name: Dark Bats
shadow_text: Shadow: Attach this card to the defending character.
text: Forced: After Dark Bats damages a character, attach it to that character. (While attached, counts as a Condition attachment with the text: "Attached character gets -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense].")

name: Fighting Among Friends
shadow_text: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [Attack]. (+2 [Attack] instead if undefended.)
text: When Revealed: The first player names a sphere. Then, all non-[Baggins] characters who do not belong to the named sphere are removed from the quest.

name: Weighed Down
shadow_text: Shadow: If the defending character is destroyed by this attack, its controller must raise his threat by 5.
text: When Revealed: Until the end of the round, exhausted characters get -1 [Willpower], -1 [Attack], and -1 [Defense]

flavor: "Old fool! Why there is a large patch in the hollow of his left breast as bare as a snail out of its shell!" - Bilbo Baggins, The Hobbit
name: A Bare Patch
text:
While attached, Smaug the Magnificent gets -3 [Defense].
Response: After the players quest successfully, the first player makes a burgle attempt. If successful, attach A Bare Patch to Smaug the Magnificent.

name: Smaug the Golden
text:
Indestructible. Immune to player card effects. Cannot be engaged.
X is the number of non-Burglar characters committed to the quest.
